Reviews.Title: Inspires me to simplify other things in my life too
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: I'm so in love with this thing. Everything on the keyboard is directly related to the browsing experience. It's the perfect machine for the average internet user. You can buy six of these for the price of a macbook, so if you're on the fence, just buy one of these and a nice desktop and use the other $600 to go on a weekend vacation.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: sanderella
Reviews.Content: It is very reliable and high functioning for the price!!  Boots quickly, lightweight and long battery life compared to c710.  Love it

Reviews.Title: Pleasant surprise
Reviews.Author: RC65
Reviews.Content: A Chromebook does not do everything a laptop can, but it does 90% of what most people use a laptop for.  Specifically, what it does, and does very well, is surf the internet.  It does this faster than any computer I've used.  It boots up in less than 7 seconds, also much faster than other computers I've used.  It has a battery life that easily lasts over 6 hours, and it also recharges incredibly fast.  Finally, it is much lighter and more portable than a laptop.  While it looks like the old "netbooks", this product is many times superior to those outdated, balky computers.  Amazingly, this product accomplishes all this magic for what I consider to be the best bang for the buck available in computers today ($200). I also own a desktop and a Kindle Fire, but this little computer has become the machine of choice for 90% of my computer time.  In summary, I have a love/hate relationship with most computers, so far with this machine it's all love.

Reviews.Title: Great for a student or anyone on-the-go!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: For the money, the Acer C720 (2GB) isn't just one of the best Chromebook on the market, it's one of the better cheap laptops on the market. For $199 at the time of my purchase, I could not be happier with what I got for my money. This 11.6" laptop is great on battery life, has stellar performance, and houses a sleek and portable form factor. Chrome OS is limited to some, but with a constant internet connection and a computer at home that you can remote desktop to (not entirely necessary), there isn't much you can't do with a Chromebook. The dual-core Intel Celeron (Haswell) CPU inside isn't power hungry, it doesn't put out much heat at all, and it powers Chrome OS like a boss. The C720 also carries 2GBs of RAM, which is plenty for most of what you'll be doing inside of Chrome. You won't have any stuttering or lag with multiple tabs open in Chrome, a video playing or music in the background while blogging on social media. At the time of this review I currently have 6 tabs open, including a livestream on Twitch.tv, and there is no lag whatsoever. Battery life is also fantastic. With social media, email, music, and word processing, you can expect anywhere from 7 - 9 hours with the C720, slightly less if constantly streaming video. I had a day where I unplugged the laptop at 7am, used it for notes and videos through school till around noon, then used it all day at work researching tech and playing videos; I ended the day at 10pm with around 49% battery, I then proceeded to use the laptop most of the next day at home before it finally dying around 3pm. So you can expect to get through a whole day with this Chromebook. Another additional benefit is USB 3.0. There is 1 on this laptop, as well as a single USB 2.0 port on the other side of the laptop. You also have full HDMI out for running an extra HDMI enabled monitor/tv. This greatly improves functionality if you enjoy having multiple displays. It's lightweight, portable, looks great and the build quality is superb for a sub $200 laptop, but there are a couple downsides. The original carried a full-size SD card slot (when inserted, the card would be flush with the laptop, making portable storage easy), the C720 lacks this, and only carries a half-depth SD card slot, minor downside. Also, there are no function keys as well as no caps lock key, like the original. I would like to be able to ALT-F4 out of Chrome, instead I have to CTRL-W to close each tab/window individually. The screen is 11.6" and has a resolution of 1333x768, which is just fine for a 11" laptop. Viewing angles and color reproduction wasn't the best, but you won't have many complaints sitting in front of the laptop for a few hours. Another downfall out of the box was the keyboard, the keys were shallow but well spaced. After a couple days of use I got completely used to this and am now typing this review on the C720 at 60+ WPM.To conclude, if you're on a budget looking for a laptop, already live inside of Google's ecosystem or are okay with living in the cloud (no classic Windows applications/limited storage), then this laptop will serve you well.The C720 has the best battery life for a Chromebook on the market, other than Dell's Chromebook 11 ($100 more than the C720 at the time of this review),which only carries a couple hours of battery life over the Acer here. Other than that, you won't find better performance, battery life and a simple, utilitarian design in any other sub $200 laptop.Pros:PerformanceBattery lifePortabilityLoud speakersGood trackpad with easy-to-use gesturesCons:Screen viewing angles and colorsLack of caps lock key and F4 key. (Search key can be swapped with Caps lock in settings)Keys are a bit shallow and hard to use at firstIf you reading this feel I didn't cover some aspect of the laptop, feel free to ask a question on this review, I'm very active in replying to Amazon questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little machine, and a steal at this price
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a Linux laptop running Ubuntu via the ChrUbuntu installer, but honestly, for what most people use a laptop for, ChromeOS works great.  Full access to the real web, no mobile site BS, and a full size keyboard are so much nicer than touch typing on glass, or a cramped expensive Bluetooth keyboard.I love the fit and finish.  Solidly built.  No creaks or squeaks.  It's just heavy enough to feel expensive, but not enough to tire you out.  Excellent battery life.  Very portable size.  Intuitive trackpad gestures make mouse interactions work almost as well as a real mouse.The only real knock I can find against it is the display.  Good viewing angles are really tight, and just a few degrees up or down will wash all of the colors out.If you're a power user, you can partition the drive in half, and dual-boot ChromeOS and Linux for a complete laptop experience without the Windows tax.  I can even install Steam and play my indie games on the go.  Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Who Needs Microsoft XP?
Reviews.Author: Carl Gluck
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know I'm overstating my case with the remark title. But really, I was perturbed with Microsoft for abruptly pulling the plug on XP. Suddenly I was expected to replace my laptop and the software on it - an expense of at least $1500 to $2000. And why? Because Microsoft got lazy? Windows 8 is horrible. I surely don't want to replace XP with that! So I decided to try a less expensive solution, if only for fun. And Wow! What an improvement! all for $250 (I bought the 32 GB version and a carrying case).At first I was a little less than enthused because after all - the Chromebook is just a glorified browser, right? Wrong! I discovered it is very easy to install a full blown version of Ubuntu Linux with all the bells and whistles - and it doesn't upset the default version of the Chromebook at all. Take that Microsoft!Linux is free. Google software is free. Web storage is free. And the new Acer Chromebook is amazing! 10 seconds from stop to online! Can't beat that. And the battery life is amazing. While this approach may not be for someone who doesn't care for computers or a big learning curve, it is a great approach for someone who has more brains than money.The C720 is fantastic. The processing speed and utility are great. And it is half the size and half the weight of my old laptop. What's not to like?Goodbye Microsoft. Hello new world. And so it goes...

Reviews.Title: Why would you buy the C720 when the Samsung 2's are about to hit?  You might be surprised...
Reviews.Author: Tim Byers
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not, on the same day I learned that the new Samsung Chromebook 2's would be released on April 28, I went ahead and bought the Acer C720.  Why?  First of all, Chromebooks have been interesting to me for a long time, but I'm not an early adopter.  I tried an Android Transformer tablet/keyboard last summer and recently work gave us Windows 8 tablet/laptops. My profile is a tinkerer--and a cheap one at that.  I have a Roku and Chromecast, I mess around with XBMC, and I try to stretch all my tech dollars.  I wanted a simple, lightweight, mobile device with a keyboard--something handy for surfing on the couch, stashing it away in a backpack and riding the bike to my local coffee shop for some writing.  The other reviews and numerous Youtubes on this unit are consistently very good.  What finally snagged me was the XP laptop trade-in deal offered by a local retailer and suggested by an article on CNET, which enabled me to bring this home at half-price.Playing with it for a night and a morning (normal Chrome apps, Outlook.com (just to see if I could still use Microsoft stuff), and Chrome Desktop), I'm convinced of a couple of things:-$200 is totally the sweet spot for Chromebooks.  This thing can do a lot and does it very fast, but it can't do everything.  Everyone should know that by now.  That's not a "con" for me.  I know this going in.  But at this price, what it does is incredible.-Waiting for the new Samsung Series means saving up another $100-200.  The new hardware looks intriguing (I'm generally a Samsung fan) and I bet it's very nice, but at $349-399 for the new units I'm starting to think Windows (the Asus Transformer Book T100, for example).  By the way, Windows 8's schizo Desktop/Metro is starting to grow on me.-$1100 for the Macbook Air was a goal until I returned to my profile and use case.  If I want a beautiful piece of hardware that I'll try to use for the next five years without much change, then maybe this is it.  But I'm also not sure I want to stash it in my backpack and crash the bike or bump it around.  I'd baby it too much.So thanks to the XP trade in, some passion from Puppylinuxworld on youtube, and reflection on my use, I took the plunge.  It's great!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for school
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this up on my Chromebook. It is very light weight and compact, so it's perfect for travel or taking to school. It's fast, thought it doesn't have much room for software. Documents can be made through Google docs and stored on cloud, so it's not a huge issue. It's kind of a bare-bones model and if that is all you need, then this is a good computer to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop !! Beats any laptop if you are using it for internet
Reviews.Author: Raag
Reviews.Content: To start with this is a way better computer than any laptop including MAC if you are using it for internet purpose( Stream videos or youtube or just browse net)  Literally starts in 5 secs and battery 10 hours ....around 7 with video streaming!It has all the wonderful google apps for documents etc if i needBest part is i am using it for more than a month now and not a single time i had to restart... I watch tons of Amazon videos as i am prime member not a single time anything hangedAnother good thing to note is it does not heat up at all! no fan noise ....i have become a non paid salesman of this product!Excellent OS google!

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Janet Lee
Reviews.Content: Easy and simple.  I should have done this a while ago.  You continue to read the reviews and it just makes you nuts.  Just order it, try it, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Randy Hillsgrove
Reviews.Content: I needed a new laptop and didn't want a heavy cumbersome device. I don't really like Windows with all of the updates and Macs are extremely expensive. I just needed something to surf with, maybe do a little online gaming, and edit some photos here and there. This device fit the bill to a T, super fast boot up. Extremely light and portable, zero heat on my lap. I've watched tv on it without issue, watched movies, listened to live radio. It really is an awesome system! I highly recommend it for those looking for an easy device to use and carry around. All kinds of apps to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Curtis J. Alphenaar "Curt"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife, thinking it would be perfect for her...I was right! But now I think it would be perfect for me too and wish I could get myself one! She had a windows computer before and I would have to always help her clean it out and make sure things got updated because she didn't understand any of that. The Chromebook has solved all of that! The updating is done in the background and doesn't slow you down.The Google operating system is easy to use, clean, and fast. It it turns on and off in seconds, and operates so fast! I really don't know the battery life, but it seems to last all day for her. She is thrilled with her new computer and I am relieved that I don't have to do a thing to it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little computer!
Reviews.Author: TonyM
Reviews.Content: I've owned the current Samsung 11.6 model and the 12.1 inch Samsung that preceded it. Both were nice, but the Acer 720 is a step up. It feels more sturdy and seems to have a bit more power. It was also quite a bit cheaper, so it's all around a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Thoroughly Impressed
Reviews.Author: Ramiel Mansour
Reviews.Content: Although not as cosmetically appeasing as the other Chromebooks on the market, this ACER C720 is very impressive for the money.  It does everything I need, for a quarter of the cost of a "full size" laptop, and is more practical than a tablet (and cheaper, usually). It's lightweight, has great battery life, a nice keyboard, and good performance.

Reviews.Title: If web access is your primary use, nothing is better for the money
Reviews.Author: M. Yu
Reviews.Content: This laptop is simplicity and elegance for $200.  I was deciding between this and another Windows netbook and decided to go the Chromebook route and was not at all disappointed.I recently bought the Asus T100 Windows convertible, which is a good machine when it works, but you have to deal with the clunkiness of Windows 8, a tediously slow charge time, wonky WiFi and a glossy screen.  The trackpad is noisy and ineffectual.  Plus, it cost me $350.  I still use it for Windows apps, but my new go-to is the C720.The C720 just works.  You open it up, it boots in a few seconds, you're good to go.  It's light and sturdy and it does most of the things I need it to do.  The fan is barely audible and the battery life is excellent (and it charges quickly).  The keyboard isn't rock solid, but I can type quickly on it and the trackpad is extremely usable.  I'm starting to get the hang of Google Apps and I'm able to do a lot of work on my Google Drive (which is synced to my desktop).  Not all my work, but enough.That said, sometimes the computer hiccups with processor-intensive tasks, but not annoyingly so.  The screen is not very good - it has an anti-reflective coating, but it's dim and muddy and the viewing angles are lousy.  The speakers are loud-ish at times, but I hate that they're under the computer where they're easily muffled.  The bezel is so wide, they might as well have put the speakers there.  I still use external speakers or headphones so it's not a deal breaker.  Most annoyingly, the SD card slot is shallow so you can't just keep an SD card in there when you're on the go; it juts out an inch.In the grand scheme of things, for $200, I will endure a poorly designed SD slot and a mediocre screen.  Battery life and usability make this machine a no-brainer.  It's not for everyone but if you need a supplemental portable or want to give your grandparents a simple way to get connected, this is it.Perhaps the best moment was when I was showing it to a friend, bragging about its portability and solid state innards.  He said while admiring it, "Oh, yeah.  I just got one, too.  A Mac Book Air."  For what he paid, I could have bought five Chromebooks.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says without complication
Reviews.Author: John Patrick Barrica
Reviews.Content: I bought this Chromebook on something of a whim. I'd been in the market for a small form factor machine for a few months and decided to take the plunge.Firstly, battery life is excellent. Haswell and the lightweight ChromeOS are great for what I needed: Email and some light productivity with Google docs. Then I started using it for other things: Netflix, Hulu and my RSS feed. Battery life remains consistently good after a month of use and the charge time of an hour and a half are fantastic.That being said, ChromeOS is definitely limited in scope and that narrowly defined usability is both a strength and a weakness. For prospective buyers, I would urge you to research ChromeOS first to see if you'd be satisfied with what it offers. The Chromebook does what it does well, but the lack of a more fully featured OS would be the main reason to turn people away from it.For my purposes I'm debating purchasing a second one for my Grandmother so she can enjoy Netflix and other streaming sites with the HDMI port. All in all a fantastic little notebook with a very divisive OS.

Reviews.Title: Acer C320 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: amicus
Reviews.Content: This new Chromebook is a major improvement upon ther earlier model, which I also have. The audio is much improved as is the speed. I highly recommend this model as it meets my needs without fuss, fear or favour and it is replacing that fiasco and dog of Windows 8.1 for me, which is, or should be a major embarrassment and lasting shame to Redmond Microsoft. I would hope that a new, if decent, CEO at Microsoft follows Google's example re simplicity and erase all traces of Windows 8 from this planet..

Reviews.Title: This thing is awesome
Reviews.Author: hungryman
Reviews.Content: Bought this one for a family member who pretty much will use to listen to music, read her emails, pay bills, and browse the internet, etc., and it's quality so far. I did some research before I bought this specific Chromebook, so I knew it was better than the Samsung Chromebook on Amazon (which I almost bought just because it had more reviews). This one is by far the better Chromebook and right from the first boot everything is very simple and it runs really fast. Just do yourself a favor and get the "Adblock Plus" addon for Chrome and you're set, it will block all ads while using Chrome.

Reviews.Title: beautiful, fast, perfect
Reviews.Author: cmitch
Reviews.Content: just got this today-- a day early as a matter of fact... i switched from a samsung chromebook to this acer and serioiusly: because i had everything backed up to the cloud, i was able to clean the old one (i'm giving it to my daughter) and set this one up in about five minutes total... beautiful machine... lots more appealing that the two macbook airs i used to have...in fact i quit itunes altogether and simply stream music... i've also been working in google docs lately and find hardly any difference between it and microsoft or apple... in fact this machine can do what i need (write, spreadsheets, presentations) and some of the newer apps i need to explore... there shouldn't be any complaints about this machine, except from tech nerds who think that this isnt's "strong enough" or "fast enough"... it rawks... i got the 32 GB version which will be way more than i need but if you do have music, movies, etc. you should have no problem w/it as it comes w/a SSD memory card slot (like my samsung) and a new usb 3.0 port that i can get 64GB or 128GB sticks for that download faster than anything on a 2.0, which it also has...and about the comment above about it being better than the macbook air-- so true, it's exactly like a macbook air, just faster and more stable (chrome OS, that is).... keypad is great, screen is great, size is perfect, weight is perfect... what more can i say?and it's all true what you've heard-- right out of the box, w/in five minutes i am online and working on something i was working on last night (because it was in the cloud)...and if you're worried about having to be online all the time for it to work, i ask you this-- when are you ever w/out access to the internet? i mean seriously come on.. if anyone is that worried about this machine not having 3g or 4g then they need to get w/their carrier and add tethering to their phones because i have the tethering option and have only used it once... and printing is a breeze; i mean, how many printers out there are already internet or google print ready? i saw a printer just the other day for less than $60...and the fact that you'll never have to worry about upgrades, viruses, etc... all automatic... and when i set it up, there they were: all my apps and bookmarks ready to go... i can't wait to have it charged completely so i can see if the battery does in fact,  last 6.5 hours...so much more than a simple netbook, and because it's google, everything works across all of my platforms-- my nexus 7 as well as my nexus 5...great value, great looking machine, great working machine... get one of these things, you won't be disappointed.03/15/2014 update:nothing bad at all, in fact still runs and works like a dream... but i have read a couple of gripes regarding the SSD Card hanging out about 1/3'... yes it does do that; unlike my Samsung which fit to at least 1/4", but really hasn't gotten in the way of anything: mostly i use an SSD card or micro SSD card w/an adapter and when i give over my micro SSD to a friend i just give him the USB adapter and use it... there are so many ways to do it to your liking... i have yet to get anything transferred from a USB 3.0 because no one i have owns a machine w/one, but i certainly will once my friend who has all the new movies finishes his new desktop tower build. that's all... keep having fun... oh yes-- wanted to mention that my camera is a DSLR Sony alpha model and w/all the photo apps out there, there's no way to make a bad photo, even w/my little point-and-shoot... just plug and play, everything basic sets itself up, you can do the customization.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: ct
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Chromebook I have ever had. It is unbelievable. Very fast. It does everything I need and more. I probably will never buy anything else as far as a Computer. For the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: A very awesome laptop!
Reviews.Author: Agazzy
Reviews.Content: I am currently a college student and I used to have a MacBook Pro, but to be honest, this laptop feels just as good, maybe even better than the latter. (Considering the major price difference!)When I come home from work or wherever, the first thing I go to when I get into my room is this laptop. It boots up quickly and everything is fast! This laptop is so light and thin that I can pack it into my book bag without a problem.Almost everything is awesome, but what I do not like about this laptop are...- The screen is a bit sub-par. It could be a little better. I think my phone's display looks way better than the laptop.- Chrome OS can be a bit confusing, but it doesn't take too long to learn and get used to.- Chrome OS could use a little improvement (no doubt it will definitely get better as time progresses).- A larger screen would be nice (but would probably make it a bit more expensive).- You can't really store any local files, considering the fact that it only has 16GB of storage.That's about it with my dislikes... here is what I absolutely love about the laptop...- Thin, light, and skinny. Perfect.- AWESOME battery life. Compared to my Dad's Windows laptop, battery life is 10x better on the Chromebook.- Fast and efficient.- Google Docs/Sheets, etc (similar to Microsoft Office products) works almost the same as Microsoft Office. I was surprised!- The keyboard response surprisingly exceeded my expectations. I love typing on this thing.- Almost everything is straight forward and simple. You turn it on, login, and bam. Go ahead and start surfing the web.I would definitely recommend this product for those who only go on a computer to use the Internet or for classwork. Definitely worth the $200. If I had to choose between a MacBook Pro or a Chromebook, I would no doubt choose the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Prefer this over a tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have two iPads, a 2013 Nexus 7, along with iPhones. I don't "need" another computer. But I do. Touchscreen devices are great for media consumption, but not for typing. Sure you can get keyboards for your iPad, but then you are just turning it into a laptop replacement, which is what the Chromebook is. Try balancing your iPad with case and keyboard on your couch armrest.I tried the HP Chromebook 11 at Best*** along with this Acer. Sure, I liked the screen better on the HP, but I didn't like the keyboard or the all white plastic. The Acer keyboard is better than the HP. I have a Lenovo laptop with their legendary keyboard and I still prefer the Acer keyboard over it.  I have fewer mistakes.The Acer has a better processor and longer battery life than the HP. The SD card slot is important if you want to load your camera's photos without a dongle.Streaming video is extremely quick on this Acer. There's some adjustments to get used to, like the Delete key is missing, (but you can hold the Alt key and press Backspace instead). Also, two-finger press of the trackpad will get you your "right click".

Reviews.Title: Fast, beautiful, intuitive. I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Daniel E. Peck
Reviews.Content: This thing is awesome. It handles the web and OS wonderfully.  It's amazingly fast.  I was blown away. Beautiful stuff! Love the HDMI port. I can remote desktop to my other machines.  And I hear this thing is going to be running Windows apps thanks to a partnership with VMWare soon.  Epic!

Reviews.Title: So far it works great
Reviews.Author: Greasyregs "Greasyregs"
Reviews.Content: I've read so many reviews on the Chromebook and finally decided on the Acer.  I use it as a casual alternative to browsing and reading my email on my smartphone (screen too small) or my Samsung Tablet 7.0 (nice but I prefer a keyboard sometimes).  This will not replace my Lenovo laptop for business travel but it seems to be perfect for pleasure travel and just around the house when I don't want to get on my desktop and pull out my laptop.Fires up quickly, easy to use if you are a chrome browser user, and great battery life (so far around 7 hours!).  I started using the chromebook with a mouse but now am finding the I can do about everything using the touchpad.  It just takes a little time to figure out all the ways to replicate the mouse actions.  More of my computer usage is with Google Drive so document creation, editing and storage is not an issue.I suspect I would have been happy with the HP or the Samsung also but this Acer works fine for my needs.  And the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Growing to love it
Reviews.Author: Camba Reader
Reviews.Content: I am a daily Mac and Windows user, but I love this thing. It is so snappy: from instant on to loading web pages, this thing is awesome. There is a learning curve to figure out what I can do offline, but I am pretty comfortable 10 days into it. Paired with a Chromecast, it is awesome. I have used it for simple and fast photo edits (Pixlr touch ups). I use snagit for screen captures, and Biblia.com to access my Logos library of books (online only - but much simpler to use than the Logos software).I changed the settings for the trackpad to "australian" and now it mimics my Mac magic trackpad for scrolling up and down a page. With the Kindle extension, I am sending pages to my Kindle.Overall, it's great.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Tod Harter
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop to run Linux on, quite inexpensive for what you get. I'm traveling and it is great to have a small lightweight machine with sufficient power and ram to run a modern operating system and applications. It works well with ChromeOS as well if you only need web-based services. Acer has done a great job with the C720s, I think they're pretty much best-in-class for this type of machine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Sac7000
Reviews.Content: Ok I'm not new to computers, PC's, Macs, iOS tablets (iPad) etc.,  Boots up in under 10 seconds, learning time is very short (hey, it's simple!) Keyboard is excellent, not backlit but come on turn your lamp on! It's lightweight and has a excellent battery life. Perfect for shopping, email, facebook, twitter and more. Bought one for my daughter and myself, we both love it and the best part is it's under $200 and very fast! Thank you Goggle chrome and Acer, you guys rock!Would I buy again? Yes!Would I recommend to a first time buyer? Yes!

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Computer
Reviews.Author: nolabola
Reviews.Content: I completely love this purchase.  I've been a Mac user for years and shy away from Windows machines.  I no longer use our Mac.  This meets all my needs.  The suite of Google Docs apps is evolved enough at this point that they provide everything you need.  I'm a periodicals librarian and do a lot of database work, and for nearly all my need Google Sheets works great.I get all day battery life no problem (8+ hours) and don't have to carry my charger around.  The screen is completely serviceable.  It's not my media machine and I wouldn't want to watch a movie on it, but for general use it's great.  Hangouts works really well.A note on dual booting with Linux.  I installed Ubuntu the day after I got it.  It worked fine, but there isn't enough stock memory to make it viable.  I ordered this drive (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00EZ2E8LQ/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1) which will fit and provide 64gb of storage.  Once I install that, it should run Linux without storage space issues.The only negative (and it's really minor) is that you can't upgrade the RAM.  Apparently it's soldered to the board.  It's not an issue, as the laptop is really snappy as is.

Reviews.Title: Great little device
Reviews.Author: Sir Isaac Newton
Reviews.Content: I am currently using this Chromebook to type this review and I couldn't be happier with the thing.  For $200 it is a little pricey because you can put down a little extra and buy a fully capable Windows laptop for around $300, but if you can find this on sale it is well worth it.  95% of what I do on a home laptop device is web based, so I knew going into it that this is not a full fledged laptop device.  For basic web surfing, it is top notch.  I have yet to see it bog down even with 10 tabs open.  There are several apps that make it more useful as well.  Battery life is also phenomenal!  I highly recommend for basic web use.

Reviews.Title: Great Machine, Blazing fast, But
Reviews.Author: Ameer Saib
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook works well and is amazingly fast, boot-up is under 10 sec. The battery last a long time. I like a lot of the chrome apps, and given time, I can see people breaking free of the Microsoft addiction. The only complaint thus far is the touch-pad which doesn't have a right and left buttons, making it sometimes difficult when making selections; a mouse is a must with this device.

Reviews.Title: Works Like A Dream
Reviews.Author: Patrick Northcraft
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet, as there are plenty of well written and long reviews here already, which I did read before buying (as I never used a Chromebook before) and I would recommend you do as well.  Simply put, I bought this because I am currently a college student and I have a Lenovo G780 17" laptop as a desktop replacement in my dorm.  It was a little too big for me to lug around to my classes everyday, so I took a gamble and purchased this as a replacement.  There are apps for almost everything.  If you need to use Office, use SkyDrive and you can make Word, Excel, and PowerPoint online for free.  I strongly recommend this product.  The screen is very clear, the battery lasts very long, and the touchpad is pretty responsive.  The only design issue I have with it is that the speakers are on the bottom of the device, but that's just me.  The sound it still good, just not great when I sit it on my lap, as my leg absorbs the sound.  Overall, I do not regret buying this, and I would definitely buy it again.  It's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: FAST, FUN, FANTASTIC: Superb Little Computer!
Reviews.Author: Rainguy
Reviews.Content: First off, let's dispense with this "But, it's ugly" gripe. It's not. At all. I find the C720 thin and sleek, and I like the graphite gray color that gives off a titanium vibe. Sure, the HP Chromebook 11 is prettier but you're foremost buying a computer here, not a piece of sculpture. As for the "Jeez, you can (unlike the HP 11)  see the slotted vents and screws . . . and EVERYTHING on the bottom" Yeah, you can. I know, because I checked. And that's the last time I looked down there. Seriously, how much time do you spend looking at the underside of a laptop? Why is this even an issue?Honestly, for me the "refined industrial chic" aesthetic of this little Acer is a plus.As for performance, it's, well, amazing. I find both the screen and speakers more than adequate. The screen, once you find the right angle on your lap or desk (which requires all of about 2 seconds) has rich colors, solid contrast and color saturation. I watched a couple of Netflix videos on it yesterday, also several YouTube vids, and they all looked . . . fine. No, not an Apple retina display. But it didn't cost me $1,200 either.  And, with an IMac G5 desktop and iPad, I am, and have always been, a Mac guy. And I still find this Acer immensely impressive and fun.The speakers, though expectedly thin on bass, are clear and resonant, though I do most of my listening via earbuds through which the Acer delivers superb, rich, and nuanced audio.But mainly, the C720 is SO fast. Pages load up almost as fast as you click on the link: BamBamBam. Even the laudatory reviews of the HP Chromebook 11 concede that its processor is paleolithic compared to that of the Haswell-driven Acer.Now, when it comes to computers, I am a certifiable cyber cretin. But within 10 minutes of unboxing the C720, I was zipping around with ease and confidence. Sampling videos, creating music playlists on Spotify, loading new apps from the store such as Planetarium, Pandora, and Old Time Radio, among others. There are still some tasks I need to figure out how to do, but I am now in my third day of use and am hugely enjoying my C720 experience.For $199, it's hard to even imagine a better, or more delightful, or more complete, package.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to a Laptop
Reviews.Author: golfman
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this new Chromebook by Acer.  I didn't buy the touchscreen so had to adapt to the finger pad which is very convenient.  However, I attached a mini-mouse to the USB port and it works terrific.  The speed of internet browsing is phenomenal.  The apps that come with it are everything you need to get you started right out of the box.  The only thing you need for full implementation of all the capabilities with your Chromebook is a Google account/G-mail account, which is a snap to set up.  Once this is established, you can obtain all the apps you want to use from the Google store if you choose.  I am a Prime Amazon customer and purchase most of my items through my Amazon account, but it is nice to have a Google account to use also.  I strongly recommend this Chromebook to anyone (any age level) if your priorities are mostly surfing the Web and using E-mail.  Great buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Seems nice, but need larger cursor size and brightness for my 83 year old eyes
Reviews.Author: Glenn Van Stephenson
Reviews.Content: I was hoping it was more like a tablet in terms of a touchcreen, but it seems pretty good otherwise.  The keyboard has a nice feel. If anyonme knows how to change the cursor size i would appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: Great Unit for basic use
Reviews.Author: New2This
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I selected the Acer C720 Chromebook for use at home.  The unit is primarily used for internet access and some limited word processing.  This unit is light.  The keyboard is comfortable, and it features a bright, easy-to-read screen.Boot time is very good and it has quickly become the favorite unit for several of the members of my household.

Reviews.Title: It does everything it needs to and does it well.
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Van Sickle
Reviews.Content: First of all, I don't  expect Macintosh Powerbook performance from this laptop. Once I admitted to myself that my laptop is really just for web browsing, I decided the Google Chromebook would be perfect. In the month I've owned one, it has performed brilliantly! The system boots in seconds, the display is crisp and bright, the package is lightweight and has a reasonably durable feel, considering the price.I can open several windows and 10 tabs simultaneously without problems. I can stream HD Youtube and Netflix on it, and while I haven't really tested battery life, it seems to have 6 hours+.Be honest with yourself as to what you really do with your laptop (wifi connected browsing and some document creation/editing), and you can spend $200 and get a really great computer.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Be Happier!!!
Reviews.Author: donetta daliessio
Reviews.Content: For 200.00 you get a pretty fast machine that does it all online. starts  up ans shuts down in just a few seconds, loads pages instantly, is very compact, and touch pad works better than any other.i hooked up my wireless mouse without issue.you would easily pay triple this price for a windows laptop that compares to this 200.00 chromebook for online use.i cant comment on the durability of the machine or its hardware because i have only had it for 3 days, but i don't see anything that looks flimsy.great for online movies, games (non download), shopping, social media, etc.

Reviews.Title: A different way of computing
Reviews.Author: MMouse
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with my new Acer C720 Chromebook.  I wanted something small and portable for using on the internet.  That is what this is.  I love typing, and I am not interested in touch screens, so this is perfect.  The 7 seconds to boot up is a real treat.  I took the Chromebook along when I spent the day at a Hospital with friend getting lengthy treatments.  The hospital has public wi-fi which we attached to without a hitch.  We had a lot of fun with the Chromebook while there at the hospital.  I have been using it regulariy at home and find it very useful and fun. I connected to my Netflix account with no problem and seem to have flawless streaming.  And it really does have 8 plus hours of battery life.I am giving 4 stars, instead of 5, for two reasons.  First, when I ordered the 2 gb of RAM Chromebook, I thought I would be able to install 2 more gigs of RAM someday, myself.  Turns out that is not possible.  It is no one's fault but my own that I did not do enough research, still, it is disappointing (upgrading is fun).  All that being said, it turns out 2 gigs of RAM seems totally ample. I can have had multiple screens open with no problem.The second negative is that the chromebook does not connect to my home network.  Yes, it connects to my wi-fi, but otherwise it does not engage with any other devices via my router.  Not even the printer.  ( in the long run, there is a way to use your home printer, via "the cloud", which I have done).  It might not be fair for me to fault the Chromebook in this regard.  It simply is not a Microsoft Windows computer, and it does not behave as one.  Its a new way of computing, and it takes a while to get the feel for it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: I was looking to buy a laptop for the portability and convenience. While doing some research for which one will suit me and my family best, I came across some info on Chromebooks. The research turned into researching which Chromebook will be best for us. After reading both customer and professional reviews, I decided to purchase the Acer C270.  I absolutely made the right choice. I don't know about other Chomebooks but this one is perfect for me and the family, we love it.It is very portable, its light weight and long battery life make it a go any where computer. It starts up and shuts down in seconds, with my desktop if I wanted to use the internet I would weigh the importance of what I wanted to check against turning on the desktop and waiting for it to load all its programs so I can finally use the web browser. So in the past I would use my phone but then have to deal with mobile page versions or the regular webpage but the inconvenience of small print and some pages just don't work on the phone. The Chromebook solved all those issues, On average I turn this thing on 5-6 times a day.My wife the same, she loves the ease of use and the fact that she can create documents for work on Google Docs. and they are compatible with Microsoft Office, Word, Powerpoint and the other tools in Office. She uses social media websites with no problems as well.My daughter uses it for Youtube and for an online game Animal jam. it performs flawless for both. I also play on WGT.com on it with no issues.Some people complain about the screen resolution, I have no issues here. I watch Netflix and other videos on here.If you are looking for something to browse the internet, watch videos and create and edit documents with a laptop. This is the computer for you. It seems now that companies are taking Chromebooks serious now and more companies will start producing these fantastic machines. I am excited for the future of these.

Reviews.Title: I think I've fallen in love.
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: It just arrived today. Was up and running in a flash. NO Windows to deal with. NO Windows updates to deal with. NO viruses to deal with. It  just worked, with no hassle.  How long does it usually take to set up a new Windows computer, while it searches for updates, makes you select settings, stalls?  NONE of that with this machine!  Set it up to use with my network in under one minute. Just typed in the password and was connected. I can't believe it. The price is fantastic. The machine works and looks great. Acer, please let us know when you are going to make a 15 or 16 inch model.  I'll buy it.

Reviews.Title: Yeah, I'm a Chrome head now.
Reviews.Author: RazzSpew10 "Rev. Neo Gnostic"
Reviews.Content: For $200, this thing is fast. Easily downloads 720P from YouTube. HBO Go, Hulu and Amazon Prime videos play quickly and smoothly. Startup is super quick and the screen is very nice and non reflective. It is quiet as there are no internal moving parts. I am very happy about how fast this Chromebook loads web pages. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE!!!
Reviews.Author: Lady Lisa
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom who isn't at all computer savvy.  It is incredibly fast and easy to use.  She loves downloading new apps and toting her little Chrome-baby all over the place!  It does everything she needs and nothing she doesn't, which is great.  I recommend it to anyone who needs a new computer but wants something streamlined and efficient.

Reviews.Title: Best $199.00 spent
Reviews.Author: Ric
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable !! Love it. works super fast. It's like turning a page of a book. Been recommending to everyone. I am truly happy with it.

Reviews.Title: My Wife is Happy
Reviews.Author: Jay B. Thompson "flea less"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer C720 for my Wife for Christmas it does all we expected and more quick booting and loading of apps a great piece of equipment for surfing the internet.While its not a monster computer seven tabs open and no problem with speed a truly great light little internet tool.When I saw the advertised battery life I was doubtful it would really perform that long between charges but I was wrong and the recharge time was amazing from 20% to full charge in a little over 1 Hour great equipment.

Reviews.Title: Great computer, unbelievable price.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Baird
Reviews.Content: This thing is amazing. Faster than my macbook pro, smoother scrolling. Juggles many tabs effortlessly. Boots faster than macbook wakes from sleep. Speedy, sharp, excellent. This has replaced my $1,200 Macbook; it's simply the better machine. Wow.

Reviews.Title: FAST !
Reviews.Author: fixitSherman
Reviews.Content: Fast and cheap.  The best device I have ever used to connect fast to e-mail, web sites, the cloud.Fully boots up in about 7 seconds.  Not as much on board software available as a regular laptop.I am gradually learning and using more of the apps available on the cloud. So much additional flexibility is available from the cloud apps.  I almost have my C720 doing as much now as a full size desktop.  My only initial frustration was not being able to connect to a printer directly.  I adjusted quickly to Google cloud print which allows you to send a print job to your e-printer from anywhere you have an internet connection. Once you get it set up, you will like it.  No wires needed.  Nice technology at a very affordable price.  Very pleased with my C720.

Reviews.Title: Not if you plan on doing 2 things at once!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was really excited for this Chromebook, but it turned out horrible. Pretty much, if I was doing more than one thing at a time, like browsing the internet and loading pictures from a flash drive, it would crash. Each and every time. We tried a lot of things to make it run more smoothly and it still continued to crash every time I did two things at once. I didn't expect a monster machine that could game and play movies at the same time, but really having a browser open while loading pictures shouldn't make it crash every time. Horrible, I returned it.

Reviews.Title: good little computer
Reviews.Author: David Rider
Reviews.Content: good little computer. If all you need is to get online...do some research or shopping. This is perfect. Perfect for class and homework too...not to big and bulky. Gets the job done...note: Does not have a disk drive.

Reviews.Title: Great but beware
Reviews.Author: J. Kirby
Reviews.Content: If my screen didn't have a burned horizontal line that started after having it on the first time, it would get 5 stars, however I sent my first one back for a replacement, and the second one has done the exact same thing.  I read that most of the problems these have is the screen.  The screen is great out of the box, turn the thing on, then within a couple of hours this line appears, and then stays there even after the device is off.  Its been growing for the past two days, so this will be the second one to send back, and hopefully the third one does not have that problem.  As for speed, its pretty darn quick, can operate multiple windows open with no lag, nice feeling keyboard.  I really love this device and want one that does not have a defective screen.I would appreciate it if Acer would message me about this.

Reviews.Title: Just a simple, cheap laptop
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: What else to you need? A laptop with just one thing: chrome. And god, does it work well. Like, really well. If you're a student, this is the device for you

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop
Reviews.Author: rsr72
Reviews.Content: Would buy again.  Very nice, quality feel.  Thin but solid.  Performs well, boots fast.  Sure, it's different.  Google is taking over.  They will be the next "Microsoft" or already are, but we benefit for now until someone knocks them off.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Harpreet Dhaliwal
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for excellent price.  Planning to buy one more. Fast but battery life is short. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 2
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Acer Chromebook. My boyfriend bought one and after seeing how great his was I ordered one for myself. They are fast, efficient and easy to use. Do not believe the claims that they are useless without internet you just have to download the right programs. I use mine for everything. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: Perfect size and it does everything I need it to.  Shipped great and packaging was excellent.  Have had it for a few weeks now with no issues at all.  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent mini laptop
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Propst
Reviews.Content: Does everything I need, nice to have a keyboard not a touch screen. Very fast and easy to use. Light, holds a charge a long time. Easy accurate touch pad.

Reviews.Title: Its great
Reviews.Author: pedro
Reviews.Content: I never realized how limited my use of computers was until I got the chromebook.But this may very well be the only computer I use from now on.It has google docs, internet and a webcam.And if I run out of space I can just use google drive.I don't even need to download videos or music, since I get it streamed online anyways.And all for the low price of 199.Also, no viruses.I was hesitant at first because the acer netbooks I got in the past were of low quality,but it seems that acer has stepped up its game.

Reviews.Title: Fast, basic computing
Reviews.Author: gesiferd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop with the intention that it be a compact, low-maintenance option for mobile computing when a keyboard is needed.  It has more than met my expectations.  The screen is adequate, the keyboard reasonably comfortable and the operation trouble-free.  The keyboard half of the clamshell is slightly convex and the space bar deposits a light, easily-removed mark on the screen if I carry the laptop in a backpack and it's compressed a bit while traveling.  I'll be getting a small microfiber cloth to cover the keyboard when the laptop's closed, which should remedy that issue.  If you go in with your eyes open, realizing that there will be some applications that you can't run on Chrome OS and being willing to find substitutes, I believe you'll be pleased with this machine.  The price is great, especially as a refurb!

Reviews.Title: No, you are not stuck with the ChromeOS!!
Reviews.Author: carl801 "Old soldier"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for years for a thin, light laptop computer that does not have Windows on it.  I object to paying the Gates tax only to immediately trash Windows and load Ubuntu.  This, finally, is that machine.  It took me all of an hour to find, download, and install Ubuntu 14.04 , which worked flawlessly out of the box.  Wireless, touchpad, networking, power management, the lot just work.  I currently have it set up to dual boot with ChromeOS, but I was so disappointed with the limitations of that operating system that I can't foresee using it again.  The machine is zippy and I feel no need for more than the 2GB of on-board memory.  However, now that I have a real operating system on it, 16GB is not nearly enough room, so I've ordered the MyDigitalSSD M.2 NGFF M2 64 GB SSD.So now I have what I wanted: a thin, light, capable laptop running my OS of choice, and I didn't have to pay for Windows in order to do it.  My thanks to Acer for building the machine, to Google for making open source ChromeOS free, and to Ubuntu and Canonical for making their OS so much better than Windows.

Reviews.Title: YES
Reviews.Author: Waleed Khan
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, yes. $200 well spent, no regrets. This basically fits all my needs. When I announced I had bought a chromebook a few of my friends were disgusted. One said that "all it does is run the internet" and another said "they break in no time". To the second guy, I'm assuming he was talking about earlier chromebooks which I heard broke very easily. Everything I heard about this one before buying it said that it was much sturdier and did not break easily. To the first guy, I said well, that's all I really need.I really needed a new laptop and as a high school student my priority was speed, lightweight, thinness, efficiency, and for it to look nice. So I started looking into chromebooks and decided that this pretty much met those needs. I'm not really a hardcore gamer, and if I really need to play computer games there's always other laptops in my home to use. I love google chrome and chrome applications for their simplicity and ease. This gave me all that without other distractions. No need to worry about antivirus, no constant update reminders, no snail-pace start up, no overheating. Just so convenient. Obviously there are drawbacks of not being able to do all that you might be able to do with a traditional laptop but I'm willing to look past that. With my high school/artist's budget I don't really expect to make much and so don't really expect to be getting some high tech piece of machinery that works to perfection.The only problem I personally face is that my WiFi connection can be pretty s***ty, but that's not the chromebook's fault. Really, if my WiFi was out while I was on my old laptop I would pretty much have nothing to do except wait for it to come back. So why waste 300 extra bucks on something over priced and over large that I won't even use when I could have this for a much better price? Another thing I had to get accustomed to was the small size. I was expecting something a bit larger and I felt a little disappointed initially when I saw it, but I got over it pretty fast. Now when I use my old laptop or another "regular" laptop, it feels ridiculously large and awkward. This computer takes everything I need and gets rid of everything unnecessary and makes my life so much simpler. DEFINITELY recommend it to anyone who's primary concern with a laptop is the internet. 5/5 for me, thank you so much Google.

Reviews.Title: One of my Favorite Things
Reviews.Author: Candy Boofer
Reviews.Content: I love this Chromebook!Pros:Size and weight: I thought the 11.6 inch screen size was going to be a little small, but it's actually quite nice. I even find it comfortable for watching Netflix and Hulu+ and the like. Plus, it only weighs like two and a half pounds so it's really comfortable to use anywhere, even in bed.Nearly silent operation: You can barely hear the fans on this thing when the room is quiet. Much more pleasant than my old laptop which would rev up like a jet engine as soon as you hit the power button.Stays cool: Even when I set it on top of my blankets in bed, it doesn't get warm at all. The fans ventilate very well. It helps that this is a low power device I'm sure.Comfortable keyboard and trackpad: I was surprised how comfortable the keyboard is on this. I thought I was going to have to learn to adjust to a smaller keyboard, but the keys are sized and spaced well that anyone would feel comfortable typing on it. And the track pad is nice and large as well. The touchpad is also great. Very functional and responsive. I like that the whole pad clicks.ChromeOS: I'd never used ChromeOS before now, but I think I really like it now. It's perfect for casual computing. Lightweight and fast. Chrome is already my preferred web browser on the rest of my devices, so I couldn't go wrong.Surprisingly versatile: When I bought this I figured I would be using it for online shopping and browsing the web and not much else. Now I find I use it to manage documents and spreadsheets through the browser based versions of Word and Excel, manage files on my Google Drive, use AirDroid to manage my phone, and even use Chrome Remote Desktop to control my desktop.Cons:There's not much I don't like here. I don't like that the power button is kind of incorporated into the keyboard. I haven't accidently pressed it yet, but I'm nervous I might. Also, I wish they would've put a caps lock key instead of the search key. I never use the search key and would much prefer to have a caps lock key. Also, I don't know for sure but I don't think the device ever completely powers down. When I try to clean it, it always comes back on whenever I touch the track pad or sometimes (I think) other keys. A little annoying for cleaning.Conlcusion:This was one of the best purchases I've made in a while. I use this all the time and it's definitely a great value for the price. And I was lucky to be able to get mine refurbished for $150. Buy this. You're going to love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Can't Go Wrong
Reviews.Author: Eloise E. Genest
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this item if you're looking for a simple computer to get you online and do the basics. You need WiFi to connect to the internet, and then you're good to go.  I search, email, stream Netflix and use Google Docs for word processing.  You can't load conventional Windows software but there are many Aps, and Google Docs recognizes Microsoft Word documents.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I can't stream MSNBC shows - and can't get a reason why not.  Their commercials stream fine though.I continue to run expensive graphic design software offline with my good 'ol XP desktop without having to get Windows 8.  (Microsoft just stopped supporting XP which is why I took it offline).  It didn't take long to get used to this Chromebook, and I'm wondering why I would want another real computer until my desktop totally bites the dust.  This is a perfect machine for now - and maybe longer.

Reviews.Title: Love this little fella!
Reviews.Author: Tina O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I am moving to New Zealand in a month and have been diligently moving my files to my Google cloud so I figured I'd give a Chromebook a try so I didn't have to lug my tower and monitor across the globe.  Score!  Just a few "wishes", but no deal breakers - I could't be happier!Wishes- page up/page down, home and backspace keys  (there are loads of new shortcuts to learn, so I suspect it's in there - just feel a bit naked without dediated keys)- Still getting used to the keyboard feel - I'm not getting that tactile sensation and am constantly have to go back and add missing letters.LOVES-  lightweight and instant bootup- variety of useful, fun, and apps I didn't know I need.  Has apps that work just like MS Office apps so I could even work from this little hunk of aweseome- sound and video are great!- just adore Google cloud and being able to access the exact same content and settings no matter what device I'm using.The only thing I'll need to do when I land in NZ is get a new plug in adapter and viola - it's all there!

Reviews.Title: Nice Machine
Reviews.Author: jimmac
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd C720.  My son likes the first one so much he "borrowed" it on what looks to be a permanent loan.  My wife and I missed the portability (our other PC is a desktop).  I use this especially for music streaming and looking up DIY info while working on projects around the house.  Very convenient.  Boots quick, runs a long time, does everything I need and expect.  A very good deal.

Reviews.Title: cheap n good .. better than netbooks
Reviews.Author: CHAN S.
Reviews.Content: good just that the trackpad does not support right click.. only can rely on 2 finger clickgood for web surfing

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Harold
Reviews.Content: For the price, this computer is awesome! Very portable, good battery life, works just as expected. Highly recommended, especially if all you do is online!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value, good performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: 15 or 20 years ago, my parents' employers decided to deploy thin clients throughout their school district.  I was appalled.  Networks being what they were, I shuddered to think of the lag they'd experience when all the teachers tried to access their accounts simultaneously, and how everything would come to a screeching halt the moment the district servers went down.My, how recent developments have changed my opinion.This was purchased to replace a poorly aging Windows XP laptop which my kids used for schoolwork.  It's fantastic.  I've always been wary of anything that won't let me save anything I want locally, but the development and steady improvement of cloud services has done a lot to alleviate that concern and the kids, who've grown up with mobile devices that have limited storage space, have no qualms with apps that both reside and save their data to Google drive.  It's not a desktop replacement, it's not a home entertainment/gaming system, and it won't allow you to hack into  WOPR to play a game of global thermonuclear war, but it'll let you write a report, email it to your mom to be proofread, video chat with said mom to go over the finer nuances of grammar, print it to a networked printer, save it to Google Drive, email it to your teacher, and then settle in for some well-deserved time on Club Penguin.

Reviews.Title: Just WOW!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Last week I bought a refurb unit direct from Acer ($150) and the unit arrived today. I bought this for my dad since he's a senior and the old Windows Vista is getting to be a real pain for him to work with. I originally purchased a Samsung Chromebook (when it was first introduced) for him but found out the printing mechanism wasn't quite there. So I've been using this Acer Chromebook tonight and it's simply a joy to use!My setup with the unit is paired with my Google CloudPrint enabled printer, Epson WorkForce 845. Set up was easy enough. Since this unit is for my dad, I'm going to get him a low-end Epson Expression XP-410. It's only $69 on Amazon and it's a steal! One thing my dad does with his current printer is using it to scan documents and feed directly to his email. I don't think the Epson does it automatically but as a workaround, he could scan the doc onto a SD card or thumb drive, then un-mount it and stick it in the Chromebook. Not as direct but the process is quite straight forward. It shouldn't be a problem for him, albeit he's 83. :-) Go dad!!I also tested the VPN connection and it works flawlessly. I have a VPN service so I could watch BBC programs via the iPlayer. Previously I've been using my Nexus 7 and hooking that up to my TV via a SlimPort connection. It's a bit of a pain but using the Chromebook, the process is much more reliable. Bluetooth works as expected. I'm very happy with how far Chromebook has come, therefore I'll be getting my own unit next week! I was planning on getting the 32GB unit but decided not to since I ordered a 64GB SSD replacement. It's only $50+ and I think it's worth it. Was thinking about the 128GB but since I'll be utilizing Google Drive (with a free 100GB for 2 years); I think 64GB is plenty; at least for now.What needs to improve? Not so much the hardware but I wish the OS has the ability to save web pages on the Shelf, or in a folder or some sort. There's a workaround on doing that but the process isn't as simple. Certain keys are missing from a traditional keyboard standpoint, but I'll adjust. If you miss your Function Keys, there's a way that you can set up your keyboard to toggle them back. It feels a bit 'odd' not being able to save anything on the 'desktop'. It's different and I think I'm going to like it, a lot!Thanks for reading.UPDATE: I just read about where the Epson Connect website has an option where you could scan directly to your Google Drive. Su-weeet!

Reviews.Title: One of the best chromebooks that happens to also be the cheapest one
Reviews.Author: J. Limandri
Reviews.Content: This is is one of the best chromebooks and I have used almost all of them.  The Dell chromebook 11 and the Toshiba 13.3 may be slightly better, but its close.  But if you only have $200 to spend on a laptop I would just get the c720 now.

Reviews.Title: Does what I expected
Reviews.Author: Travis Carter
Reviews.Content: As long as you know it's Google Apps only you'll like it. I thought it would be too small but it's not bad. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice little machine
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Insco
Reviews.Content: This does exactly what I need it to do for under half the price of a traditional laptop. The only reasons I don't rate this as 5 stars is the touchpad and I thought I was getting an ssd card but I did not receive one with my order. In all fairness though how many touchpads are good? This is why God created the cute furry rodent called a mouse.

Reviews.Title: Easy and light
Reviews.Author: Franky
Reviews.Content: This is the best travel computer that I have owned; it does everything I need and the price cannot  be beat.

Reviews.Title: Great travel machine, excellent battery life
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this review on my chromebook.  I love it.  It's featherlight (well not really but it's very light), it's compact and it's fast.  I was worried about keyboard size as I'm a pretty big guy (6'3") and have big hands but it feels just fine to me.  Best things about it are the boot up time (it really is about 7 seconds, 3 if it's just waking up from sleep) and the battery life which can stretch all day if I'm only using it for 30 minutes at a time here and there.  I think I last charged this last night and 24 hours later, I still have 60% left since I only used it twice this morning.It's not a full laptop so if you get it to do productivity things (spreadsheets and documents) you probably won't like it.  But if you want something to travel with that will do everything you need without leaving a huge dent in your wallet if something happens to it, this is the machine.  Really happy with the purchase, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect alternative to a tablet with a keyboard
Reviews.Author: Kim Haman
Reviews.Content: He loves it.  It is lightweight, does what it says it does.  If you need a computer for just browsing the web (as he does) it does the job.  Is super fast, lightweight, works great.  We couldn't be happier with this purchase, it's his current favorite toy ;)

Reviews.Title: Impressive piece
Reviews.Author: Mhoward8
Reviews.Content: This is a surprisingly impressive unit based on the price. The specs are obviously not going to be up there with the specialized models and their 3rdand RAM are great for light, office work.The performance is also smooth despite its disadvantage in hardware and the picture quality is adequate, considering. The best feature though is the Chrome OS, which uses up very little memory despite dishing out considerable power. For a cheap laptop, you’re getting a lot of value.gen I series processors, but the battery life, memory

Reviews.Title: nice chome book
Reviews.Author: On-Awa S.
Reviews.Content: I really like this chrome book well belt good charger best price.  If your looking for a smaller laptop in this price range it's a good buy it seems to be a little better brand than other's

Reviews.Title: Great item!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Runs wonderfully.  Battery life is amazing.  Keyboard and touchpad are acceptable (for the price they are pretty good).  Installed linux via crouton, and now it runs everything I could ever want --- including skype,  and microsoft office (under wine).  Awesome machine.

Reviews.Title: Better than Windows laptops
Reviews.Author: fai
Reviews.Content: Excellent fast boot-up, very smooth operation (similar to macbook air), good battery time, well outlook and keyboard and build-up, extremely low price, good for elderly and kids, excellent alternative to windows 8 OS. No regret.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: catherine "cl"
Reviews.Content: This is such a great computer, and for the price, it is amazing. It is extremely fast and light. It serves my purpose beautifully.Keyboard is fine. I knew there was no DVD or CD player in the machine which was not a negative for me.Overall,love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Eric von Spreckelsen
Reviews.Content: Already have the HP Chromebook 11.  Had some problems with the charger and battery life, but liked that Chromebook enough to order another, as my family steals my HP more often than not.The C720 is much better.  Battery life is outstanding.  Even charging takes less time.  Battery life lasts 3 times longer than the HP Chromebook 11 too, plus it has more ports, including an HDMI so I can use it at work for presentations.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the price.
Reviews.Author: Matthew J Carling
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a little while now and it performance is excellent for my use.Pros====As a browser (obviously) it's very quick and chromecasting youtube has been faultless so far.Having used netbooks in the past, this 11" seems the best compromise between portability and screen size in a standard ratio.Dual monitor mode via HDMI supports both extended desktop (each screen at their own native res) and mirroringNot really a pro for Acer but some of the chrome apps are pretty handy such as remote desktop and ssh clients which improve it's versatility for those who sometimes need to use windows, osx, etcCons====- The keyboard is slightly on the cheap and cheerful side. It operates fine and I have had no problems - it just reflects its budget.- No native support for all video codecs - a specific use case for me in to copy video from my contour cameras to a usb drive while holidaying. No problems with the usb to usb copy but chromeos does not have support for native contour mp4 files to do local playback. A nice to have but not a deal killer. On the plus side, uploading gps files to Strava etc works fine - just manually upload the file off the Garmin flash.Other====For any Aussies, the AC power cable unplugs from the power pack - just swap the US end for an Aussie one. It's a standard clover leaf laptop cable.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Micha gutwilik
Reviews.Content: I love my chromebook. This newer version doesn't have nearly as many pauses and shutdowns as my last one. I just wish the google  doc/spreadsheet/slide apps were more similar to microsoft versions.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Kathy Pierce
Reviews.Content: It didn't cost much, but I don't need much.  Just right for what I use it for...e-mail, shopping, streaming, surfing.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook c720
Reviews.Author: ABC721
Reviews.Content: I just received my new Chromebook.  So far, it is great!  Very easy to set up and get going...no issues with initial connection to our wireless network.  Easy to set up my online banking and bill pay accounts.  I think for what it is (primarily a browsing device) it is a zippy little machine :0)

Reviews.Title: Great on many levels but be aware of what you can't - yet - do
Reviews.Author: A G SMITH
Reviews.Content: For a good value lightweight, attractive laptop with superfast boot-up and a fab battery, it is really good.  As I live in Cyprus however, the Google play music/movie apps aren't 'yet' available, and I used to have a UK ip address to watch UK tv.  This is no longer possible and I am scouring the internet for a possible solution.  I realise that the whole point of the 'op speed' is that there is nothing downloaded or stored on the Chromebook.  SO - get 'cloud' friendly and it would serve you well for a great price.  Would only otherwise consider a Mac or £500+ alternative

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: cam
Reviews.Content: I must admit at first i was a little skeptical after using windows for so long but this has super exceeded my expectations by far. The only thing cheap about it is the price. Dont take my word for it try it yourself. Speed, durability, no clutter, perfect size, not to small not to big and it has flash already installed which is a major plus. Im officially team chrome :)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little computer.
Reviews.Author: Shannon Caissie
Reviews.Content: For almost four and a half years, I've been using an Acer Aspire One netbook running Windows XP, so it would have been nearly impossible to get a new computer that DOESN'T run better, faster, longer, and quieter.Things I like:-this thing cost over $100 less than my old netbook, has a bigger screen, and is lighter and thinner-using 3 fingers on the trackpad to switch between tabs-although there's no dedicated monitor on/off button, you can turn the screen brightness down to the point of the screen going black-it boots up so fast I barely notice a difference between it turning on and it coming out of sleep mode-I've actually used every key on the keyboard-I can pick it up by one corner and I don't hear a cracking sound.Things I don't like:-there's no Delete key which I had gotten into the habit of using a lot when my old netbook's backspace key started becoming unreliable, instead there's "alt+backspace" and the power button is where the Delete key used to be on my netbook so I've almost put the computer into sleep mode a couple times-there's no number pad, not even a "fn +" number pad like on my old netbook-when the fan does turn on, it tends to turn on for like one second, cool down enough to turn off, and repeat every two seconds for a while, but I'm pretty sure that's not terribly abnormal for a laptop. It's not loud, it's just annoying when it keeps turning on and off.Things I am ambivalent towards and simply have to get used to:-I have turned this thing on like once since I got it because it turns itself on/wakes itself up every time you open the lid if it possibly can. That includes the very first time you plug it in which startled me a little.-there's not much available in terms of customization/options for stuff like when it sleeps/turns off the monitor, but there's not much I've felt the need to change in the first place-the keyboard labels are in all lowercase-I can't use the NotScripts chrome extension because I can't get into the program files to set the password, but seeing as the Chrome OS is supposed to be nearly immune to viruses I probably don't need to worry-there are no function keys, but the only ones I used were for refreshing and fullscreen, and there are keys for those-the caps lock key was replaced with a "Search" key but one of the customization options they do give you is the ability to change it back to a caps lock key so naturally I switched it right back-when I press the keys, they don't go down very far so I kept feeling like the keystroke couldn't possibly have registered properlyIf you spend a lot of time online and/or writing, a Chromebook is probably right for you.If you're into gaming, digital art, etc., you're better off getting a more conventional computer.

Reviews.Title: Great all doer
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel V.
Reviews.Content: Fast, fluid, great battery life and hassle free updates. A must buy for anyone looking for a great laptop at a great price

Reviews.Title: Great for school
Reviews.Author: Bubble Blower
Reviews.Content: Bought these for my 9th grade twins and they are working good. Internet is fast, battery life is good and Google docs has everything my children need for school automatically saved on Google Drive. If I could ask for one improvement it would be to simplify printing. My printer is not Google Cloud Print ready so setting up to print has been a little difficult.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap laptop.
Reviews.Author: OG
Reviews.Content: My main laptop is the Macbook Air 13", but I recently got the C720 as a cheap alternative to take with me on short business trips, while I leave the MBA at home for my wife to use. It is very good for the price and the touchpad is surprising decent. However, one issue that has come up is a high pitched sound coming from the laptop. This is only audible in quiet rooms but it is there. More than a few people have experienced this issue and have posted about it online. I will probably bring it into a store for exchange but others haven't had any luck. If it were not for this issue, I'd give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Brendan Stringer
Reviews.Content: This machine is a great value. The battery life is about eight hours as long as you don't have the screen on full brightness. It also has an intel processor which makes running Linux or some other operating system on it very accessible.

Reviews.Title: The Best Laptop For its price
Reviews.Author: Matthew Cooper
Reviews.Content: PROS-  This laptop is amazing! It does everything you would do in a normal desktop computer, but it is a fraction of the price! Everything about it it perfect. We use the hdmi port on the side to watch Netflix on out TV. Chrome OS is very nice and easy to use.Over all the laptop is Great!CONS- There are not very many bad things about this laptop. The keyboard feels a little weird and the speakers are on the bottom of the laptop. But you will get used to both.So, other than that, it is a great laptop and i strongly recommend that you buy!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic alternative to a Laptop and/or a Tablet
Reviews.Author: WLT
Reviews.Content: Basically, this is an Android Tablet without a Touch Screen and with a Keyboard Attached.  You get 2 gig of operating memory and 16 gigs of app memory for your apps and music and movies.  There is a full SD card port on the side, as well as an HDMI output and two USB Ports.Also, there are decent speakers (Stereo) and a Mini Cell Phone type port for using your Headphones with Mic.  Yes, it has a mic/speakers and camera built in, but you can also plug in your Smartphone Headset and listen or make calls with Google Voice.It's lightning fast OS (Android) compared to my old Windows Laptop, AND, everything happens in the cloud (Google Drive).  You have to print via cloud. There is no printer output.  It does have Bluetooth as well as Wifi. Screen resolution and brightness are GREAT.If you want a cool and useful alternative to your Laptop and/or Tablet while mobile, this may be it.  Google has done a great job with this OS.  It does the basics and is economical - AND - the battery lasts for 8 hours or more!  You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: a
Reviews.Author: Eddie Ramos
Reviews.Content: Very nice laptop. Use it mainly for movies but also has Microsoft office. Good size and good price. No problems since I've bought it. Also you can download apps just like a phone can.

Reviews.Title: Drops wi-fi constantly
Reviews.Author: QC
Reviews.Content: At least the model that I purchased did not connect to wi-fi networks in a stable manner. It kept dropping from the network constantly -- unlike my MacBook, which is always connected to the internet without any problem.

Reviews.Title: Love it, gifted one already
Reviews.Author: Andrew Latham
Reviews.Content: As an Open Source advocate I wanted to try a Chromebook. I liked the specs and feel of the C720. I ordered one for myself and use it often. I also ordered one for my nephew as a gift. Very light, long battery life, great screen, nice keyboard, HDMI and some other useful ports. It was a bit hard but I did find a spare power supply here on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs and well worth the price.
Reviews.Author: A.Fenderson
