Reviews.Content: I've tried using my smartphone and a couple of Android tablets as devices to surf the web on while watching TV, and none of them ever gave me an enjoyable experience:  while two of them actually had slightly higher resolution screens than this Chromebook, none of them were easy to navigate for me due to links being too small to easily click on and my strong preference for physical versus virtual keyboards.  So I wanted a small, light laptop that would allow me to surf the web while getting the benefits of a laptop vs tablet (touch type and precision pointer/click control).  This Chromebook fits all of my needs easily.  I get over 7 hours on a single charge (though unfortunately my battery level and charge-time indicators are somewhat inaccurate), and web pages load very quickly even on a 802.11-g router that's connected to slowish DSL.  I plugged a USB headset into this and was able to use it to do a Google video call in combination with the built-in 720p webcam with no driver install process or setup issues at all.  I use this at home, work, and the homes of family members, and it seamlessly transitions between wifi access points.  I did encounter one issue that only ever happened on an AT&T; DSL connection where images and pages sometimes were timing out or not loading, seemingly due to DNS issues, as though the browser were giving up too quickly to resolve and/or load, but hard-setting DNS to always use Google's servers seems to have fixed that issue.  Which brings up a good point:  for those willing to use Google and do some tinkering, even without installing Linux there are lots of settings and tools you can use to get a bit more functionality and customization than what the standard ChromeOS interface provides.Two issues worth mentioning:  any SD card will stick about half-way out of the card slot, which is unfortunate.  After extensive searching, it seems that there is no current micro-SD to full-size SD adapter that will fit completely within the slot, either.  The screen is also somewhat low-end:  while the resolution has not yet been a problem at all, the viewing angles and blue-haze common to low-end LCD panels are both very apparent here.  I sometimes find myself tilting the screen to odd angles in an attempt to mitigate the viewing-angle problem, but it's a minor inconvenience overall.  Watching 720p/HD streaming shows/movies is entirely possible thanks to the decent CPU/GPU, but the picture quality, especially in darkish scenes, will suffer on this screen.  Luckily, there is also a full-sized HDMI out port that you can use to connect to a better monitor or TV when available.

Reviews.Title: My New Favorite Mobile Device
Reviews.Author: 50yardliner
Reviews.Content: I bought this because some teachers in my District (where I help advise for school technology purchases) were interested in the Chromebook.  I read reviews but I had to get one myself to truly understand what it could do and not do.The verdict: I love it! For most students in the core subjects, it will do just fine! For people that are using specialized software, this isn't the device because you can't install software on this. Basically, if you can find what you want on the Internet without having to install anything to run the application, you are good to go on this device! The web tools that can't be used on here due to needing JAVA or similar software have some type of alternative on the Google App Store for free - at least what I needed. As far as storage limitations, you can always get additional cloud storage through Dropbox.  For a student that can afford to delete files or upload to other cloud storage solutions, I say go for it. I'm not planning on activating the 2 years of extra storage.  Therefore I am not going to be concerned with having to pay a fee in 2 years.For word processing, presentations, etc., you can use Google Drive or Microsoft's version - OneDrive.  There's lots of free web apps out there so most people won't miss the fact that you can't download software.Limitations:  It took me a little time to get used to the mouse and the fact there is no delete key.  But once you get used to it, it's no big deal.It's lightweight, has awesome battery life....I can't say enough about this device.  It's my new favorite toy!

Reviews.Title: Here is what you get
Reviews.Author: Bobby Harakat
Reviews.Content: for 200 bucks you get a chrome internet browser with all chrome web aps such as note and spread sheet...sounds a bit dull but that's only what comes stock (which is ample enough for the regular web surfer user)using crouton script you can install a plethora of different Linux distributions which will allow you to do pretty much anything you want, so long as what you want does not exceed the hardware limitations. using Linux Unity with Ubuntu GUI i am able to use this to play some video games via wine (nothing too fancy since you dont have a GPU) I am able to do my homework using Libre Office tools and even use programming software compilers for VB and C++if it sounds a little techy for you don't worry, installig linux and making this computer into more than a web browser is very easy , just look up how to install linux on youtube(WARNING INSTALLING LINUX VOIDS WARRANTY)

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 is a screamig fast Chromebook at a fantastic price
Reviews.Author: Alpine-X
Reviews.Content: I wont rehash all that others have said, but to sum it up... It's :Light weight and thin (drops into a backpack like its not there.Runs SilentRuns coolKeyboard and Touchpad are very niceScreen is good, but not Fantastic (I wish there was a contrast adjustment). The viewing angle is fairly narrowBattery life is FANTASTICSound is goodOperation is great, runs smooth, fast, boots in seconds, full screen video is smooth, connects to WIFI easilyGoogle Chrome works great for 99% of what I do ( I haven't used my other laptop or tablet in two weeks)printing to my wireless Epson 410 is a breeze with Google Cloud Printpick yourself up a Caselogic LAPS 111 neoprene sleeve to protect it while out and about....and your good to go..

Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop (Don't buy Refurbished!)
Reviews.Author: A. Bahls
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this Laptop a 5 star review because the C720 laptop I eventually ended up with is awesome.  The C720 laptop I BOUGHT through Amazon however was not.  I already left a 1 star review for the seller of my original Refurbished C720 laptop, and it didn't seem right giving the laptop itself a bad review when it was the sellers fault.Long story short, it was defective, the warranty service sent it back to still defective, so I returned it in less than a month after I bought it.  As soon as I received the confirmation from the seller for the return, I went to BestBuy and bought the exact same laptop.My C720 is going strong, I've got a 32gb USB 3.0 micro flash drive running Ubuntu for all the apps I can't run in Chrome.

Reviews.Title: So light!
Reviews.Author: R. Clayton "Alldayer"
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this laptop fits perfectly for what I want. Quick, fast, reliable, Google OS updates every 6 weeks, don't need a firewall or virus protection! It's that simple. Wish the keyboard would light up, hard to see at times. All laptops at this price-point are the same though

Reviews.Title: Small, easy to use and why not 5 star
Reviews.Author: Zulma E Brooks
Reviews.Content: Well, it came fast so i was happy about delivery time. As per the computer itself. Small, "Search" key is on the left side where the enter key use to be so i had to get use to it being switched around. The down side is that I can't use my HP printer with it and would have to either buy an "e-printer" of whose 3 separate inks cost two babies and a mule so I'll just switch my old laptop back and print from there. I left the plug in a bit too long and it popped off then back on again and I smelled something burnt. Scared the hell out of me but there was no damage after i charged it later after it cooled down. This is a delicate machine so no pounding on the keys or keeping it plugged in due to its quick charging Lithium battery. I get 5 hrs out of it not 8. I blog and run my biz online so its a blessing and durable but i would much rather have my bigger, sturdier laptop. Learning the shortcut keys took a while but over all the Chromebook is for light internet browsing not heavy duty stuff.

Reviews.Title: My husband loves it!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: My hubby is not exactly a computer genius but he has learned to like cruising the net since he has been home recovering from a work-related injury. He can sit on the couch, prop up his leg and watch TV while checking out the web. He loves it and I am happy my laptop is free again so I can do my work! This chromebook is prefect for my hubby and will be great to take along while traveling. It will NOT take the place of a laptop if you need to store files and it will not burn CDs or play DVDs.

Reviews.Title: graduation gift
Reviews.Author: martha
Reviews.Content: my neighbor girl will graduate this year, heading on to college, so we got her this and gave it to her early. she loves it and is glad we let her have it now as she needed it for studies and her grades have improved since receiving it. thank you for such good prices that allowed us to fit this into our budget.

Reviews.Title: Wow.
Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: 99% of my work is spent on Gmail and Google Docs. While I'm doing that I listen to music on Spotify.This little machine does all this fantastically.Very cheap, very easy to use.It does stream video just fine (netflix, youtube, hbogo, nba league pass, tnt live, etc).Very easy to throw in my backpack and head to a coffee shop.If it gets lost or stolen, not a big deal.I still have a MBPro to do some more heavy duty computing, but I'm glad I don't have to carry it everywhere.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: This is a best buy
Reviews.Author: Leon Noel
Reviews.Content: You know how you buy something and after you get it you feel let down because it did not meet your expectations? Well, this Chromebook has far exceeded mine. It makes you wonder why some of us even mess with windows for surfing the web or most any web based activity. This computer is really fast. My only minor gripe is I wish the screen were a little better but it is really not bad at all. I just tried it on Netflix and it looks pretty darn good. I would have paid more for a little better screen but for $239 it is more than adequate. For the price this is a stellar value. I would buy it again in a heartbeat. Get one, I think you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for $199.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This computer is perfect for everyday use. Long battery life, very smooth OS, light, and thin. I wanted something to replace my old netbook. I haven't run into anything where I wished I was using a Mac or PC. For the price this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal buy. Fast, Light, Battery life is insane. Get it.
Reviews.Author: Brian White
Reviews.Content: Wow. Bought a few of these (one for me and one for the wife). For less than $400, these two Chromebooks do just about everything we need them to. Only have one Windows desktop PC in the house now for storage and photo editing. For portable use, there is very little reason to NOT get a Chromebook since they are perfect for laptop-type usage. Even my daughter has our older C710 in her room hooked via HDMI to a 32" TV and wireless Logitech keyboard/mouse so she can watch her shows and browse/research. The mouse and keyboard was plug and play. Literally took 10 seconds. Unreal compared to Windows. So, we're almost exclusively a Chromebook family now. We have a few HP wireless printers and these Chromebooks print via Google Cloud Print to them flawlessly. Nice!Father-in-law replaced his aging desktop PC with Windows XP to the larger Toshiba Chromebook that's $279 but has a larger screen. The simplicity and speed blows him away. And, no more hours spent doing technical support, waiting on mounds of updates to process all on a Windows install that's not really needed. I would surmise almost everything most home computer users need can be done in a browser and simple file system. That's a Chromebook...It's pretty amazing that I can get a Nexus 5 and two fast and long-lasting Chromebooks for almost exactly the same price as an iPhone 5S with 32GB of RAM. So, that's what I've done :-)

Reviews.Title: Not for everybody but I like it.
Reviews.Author: wwrrmm1953
Reviews.Content: I purchased this chromebook for travel.  It is light and easily fits in my shoulder briefcase.  It does not do everything a real laptop does but if you need something that give access to the internet and get your email and do a good amount of travel, this is a good option.  Cheap enough so that if it is damaged while travelling it is not a major concern.  The full purchase price is about double what most places want to just look at a laptop that is not working.  I have also used some Microsoft office products with the google apps and they have transitioned reasonably well for me.  It takes time to get used to but again, for the price and ease of travel, a very good buy.  I love mine.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money!!
Reviews.Author: Tammy L. Sawyer-white
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these for my 13 year old daughter to do homework on, and I am really impressed with this little machine! She is able to do home work, watch video's on Netflix, play music and the camera on it works great. I have a HP Envy, and it doesn't stream movies as nice as her Acer C720 and HP and I are discussing this matter currently. I am thinking about purchasing another Acer C720 because I am so impressed with its capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Very handy
Reviews.Author: schultsie
Reviews.Content: I love this little Chromebook. Easy to use and fast. Also handy to take along when I travel. Much smaller, lighter, and faster than my Toshiba laptop.

Reviews.Title: Convenient and good graphic performance
Reviews.Author: Coffeebean Crusher
Reviews.Content: I used the Acer C720 primarily for video streaming to HDTV and that was exactly what it delivered. 4.5-star...Pros:-  Simple operation: plug in the power and turn on the power, that's pretty much it!-  Efficient packaging: just enough materials to protect the content, not too much waste materials just to fill the space-  Opened multiple windows and no lagging, new Haswell CPU packed enough horsepower under the hood-  Nice display and extended to secondary HDTV was very easy,Cons:-  Not exactly a huge issue but the internal battery is not detachable, that could have been the fifth starConclusion:A tablet would be a little under-powered for heavy video streaming and a full-blown laptop would be an overkill, so the C720 Chromebook became the best alternative for me. The easy-setup was just as advertised and the 7-second boot time is no joking at all, cool! It automatically checks for browser updates and there was no need to worry about dealing with register conflicts from various protection apps. Plus C720 runs completely silent with no fan noise like a laptop. Full keyboard making it a lot convenience for people who typed a lot like myself. I would have given this little guy a full 5-star if the battery can be removed to extend the life. It earns  a well-deserved 4.5 stars from me.

Reviews.Title: love this chromebook
Reviews.Author: Janine R. Costilla "horse lover"
Reviews.Content: the quality of this chromebook is great,  sturdy.  It has everything I need,  Wireless printing is setup with my simple hp deskjet 1010, really easy to understand, and setup,  startup is really fast, as well as shutting down. Fun notebook,  It is my main computersimply love it even the camera is fun with its different effects, such a aliens and ghostwould highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!!
Reviews.Author: TX_res001
Reviews.Content: I have Mac book pros, MS desktops/laptops, netbooks, ipads, android tablets, etc etc.  This product completely wow'ed me.  Not since I picked up an IPAD years ago have I been this impressed.Battery life - amazingFast boot - 7 sec or lessPower saving - amazing, stays on for days with no charging and just hit a key and you're running.  Best power saving capabilities I've ever seen, even better than IOS.Keyboard - very niceDisplay - does it's job, nothing greatSpeed - wow wow wow - I swear I have a quad core+ desktopFunctionality - near perfect for 2014, can't wait to see what's around the corner.Took 30 minutes to load Ubuntu so I can have dual boot capability and run everything that linux does and Chrome OS doesn't- works near perfectly out of the box (screen brightness keys don't work out of the box but everything else does).$199.......near perfection.

Reviews.Title: Online software has come a long way
Reviews.Author: CAC1031
Reviews.Content: This is my second Chromebook and it is definitely a step up from the Samsung 303--faster, better battery life and nicer screen and speakers.I am all in with Chrome OS and will soon get a Chromebox to replace my bloated, sluggish Windows desktop.  I have found that there is literally nothing that I personally want or need to do on a computer that cannot now be down in the cloud. I have used Windows programs for years for amateur photo, film and sound editing but now there are terrific online alternatives (for the most part free) for all those things--for example, Pixlr Editor, WeVideo and AudioSauna, respectively.  There are online programs for business needs, file conversion and of course Google's office suite, with its new integration with third-party add-ons, has all the functionality that 95% of users could need.If you want to find any online alternative to your local software just Google what you want to do followed by "online"  and chances are you'll find various options. But the best part is that the future is even brighter with the functionality of the OS constantly growing.  Rather than having a machine that slows down and demands more troubleshooting with time,  you have one that is getting better with each background update.There are some people who will need one of the traditional OSes for a while longer--certain professionals and gamers--but for the vast majority of users who are willing to try alternatives to their legacy programs,  the benefits of Chrome OS--speed, security, lack of frustrating technical problems--is well worth the switch.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: J. Beacher "JB"
Reviews.Content: It feels more expensive than $200. The battery life is great; over 8 hours consistently. I use a lot of google's services and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Carrie Robinson
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of a product before, but I purposely signed back in to Amazon.com in order to write this one.  Upon receiving the laptop, I was up and running within 1 minute.  The Acer C720 Chromebook is perfect!  It is lightweight yet durable.  I have already dropped it three times and it is still working perfectly.  All of the applications are user friendly and you can jump from application to application with ease.  I absolutely recommend this laptop for anyone that is looking for an inexpensive every day PC.  If I had any complaints at all, it would be that it doesnt have a DVD drive.  And I am a little confused about why the speakers are located at the bottom of the device...but other than that - this was an ideal purchase!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: robert fierst
Reviews.Content: Great laptop without all the hassles of Windows. Does everything I need and more. Fast bootup, no need for anti-virus, long battery life, automatic updates every 6 weeks and simple to use.  Best of all the price.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Sandy M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Chromebook as another method to connect to the internet.  It was the easiest setup.  Had it up, running, and connected to our wifi in less than 5 minutes.  The battery life is amazing.  For us it is about 10 hours.  Using the microphone to search for sites or items makes surfing easier than ever imagined.We were so impressed with the speed and ease of use that we ordered a second one to use along with our desktop.Going into settings and adding our classic printer was also amazing.I would absolutely recommend this to anyone that does a lot of web surfing and emailing.

Reviews.Title: This is a computer for everyone. NOT for hardcore users
Reviews.Author: Omar Morales
Reviews.Content: It is a very good "laptop", I recommend this only to people which have already adapted their computing life to an online way of life. This is not for hardcore gaming, not for having loads of music files but the google drive is a wonderful experience, which supplies all the harddrive needs. For the computer itself, it is wonderful, small light and pretty straight forward to use. I recommend this computer to the average browser and ever college students.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value!
Reviews.Author: PL
Reviews.Content: I've read too many reviews that whine about this and that supposedly missing from the C720.  It all makes me laugh.  What do people expect for $199?  I expected a lot less than I got.  The C720 is lightening fast, powers up immediately, and is child's play to use.  It even found my iPhone hot spot without a hitch, so I can take the laptop anywhere there isn't a dedicated Wi-Fi signal.  Amazingly, I plugged in my wireless Microsoft Mouse and it worked immediately.  This laptop is a wonder of simplicity, speed, and portability.  It's light yet sturdy enough to last.  Most of what I do is Chrome based to begin with, so this is perfect for me.  Word documents I've moved to Google Drive or open in my email are perfectly readable.  Same with PDF files.  I have a new desktop for Microsoft intensive tasks, an iPhone and iPad for causal use, and now the C720 for intermediate work.  I bought this to replace my two outdated XP Dell machines--and I couldn't be happier.  I especially like the no worries anti-virus controls built into the background of the C720.  If I lose this, I won't be happy but I won't be out all that much money.  It's almost a disposable laptop--and a fine one at that.  For a Chromebook this simply can't be beat.  Buy one.  You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook, but power issues out of the box.
Reviews.Author: J. Temple
Reviews.Content: I want to give 5 stars, but for now I cannot.  I purchased the C720 on 2/8/14 and within the first 48 hours I experienced a few "crashes."  I chalked them up as crashes and within the first week focused on finding a bad Chrome extension.  I eventually disabled all extensions but the issue still persisted.  About once a day I would experience a "crash."The next step was to contact a Chrome Ninja who did some troubleshooting with me and eventually had me do a powerwash.  After trying this and sending some system data they indicated my Chromebook had been put in developer mode and that they could not help me.  This was interesting because a) it was a new Chromebook and b) while I know what developer mode is I certainly did not perform the steps at any time to enter into developer mode.  After explaining this to the Chrome Ninja he reviewed the information I sent again and said the Chromebook was no longer in developer mode but had been put in dev mode at some point in the past.  Given that, he said the only way for him to continue to assist was for me to do a full recovery of the machine.  No big deal, I made my USB recovery disk and completed the task and started over.After performing the recovery, the machine was still randomly "crashing" 1-2 times per day.  After the Chrome Ninja reviewed the latest system info he replied back and said I have a power issue and that I'd need to contact Acer for support/repair.  What I ignorantly wasn't realizing is that the Chromebook wasn't necessarily crashing, it was completely shutting down.  I should have realized that given that I had to press the power button each time it happened for the Chromebook to boot back up, but I just wasn't putting it together I guess since this is my first Chromebook.Now that I realized what was happening (thank you Chrome Ninja), I contacted Acer for repair since I had unfortunately purchased the Chromebook from Best Buy and I was past my 14 day return window.  At first, Acer wanted me to pay for shipping to their facility in Texas.  While I was annoyed they would even think I would pay for shipping (I told them the Chromebook was brand new and less than 30 days old) it was admittedly not that hard to get them to pay for the shipping.  I simply asked the Acer support representative and it took him about 5 minutes to confirm a free shipping label would be approved.  After a brief hold, he came back and said he was emailing me a shipping label.So, that's pretty much where I stand.  I have shipped my brand new Chromebook that I've used maybe a dozen times off to Acer for repair.  While I consider myself an understanding person, I'm quite disappointed that I'm now without my device for a period of time.  I can only hope that they actually repair it correctly and that the issue does not occur again.  Given the random nature of the issue, I'm skeptical at best.  I am hopeful though given the fact that there are so many positive reviews for this device I have to be an anomaly.I will update my review and rating once I get the device back from Acer.  If anyone else experiences a new machine that just randomly shuts down, don't wait until the return period is over... just swap it out for a new one immediately!UPDATE: 4/15/2014-----------------My Chromebook has been in repair with Acer twice now.  The first time, regarding the power issue above, they simply "Reloaded OS" and sent it back.  I had told them, more than once, that I had already done that and it didn't help.  After receiving the Chromebook back in late March, I began to experience the same issue of the Chromebook just randomly powering off on the very day that I received it back from repair.  So, I immediately called Acer support and they immediately, without trouble, sent me a shipping label (again) to send it back for repair (again).  After just 1 day of having the Chromebook back in my possession, I turned around and shipped it off again.I received the Chromebook back today, 4/15, with a note reading, "Unable to replicate symptoms of the unit shutting down.  Unit remained powered on while streaming videos from youtube for more than 24 hours.  No trouble found."  Fair enough, but at this point I'm just waiting for the issue to happen again, at which time I will send it in... again.  Luckily, Google has been very helpful and they are helping me figure out what the issue is.  I just have to wait for it to happen again and they're going to analyze the data I send them from a feedback report.I'm trying to remain patient as I know my issue is difficult to replicate and is very random, but I would love to be able to talk to a more technical person at Acer to explain my issue as I believe things are getting "lost in translation..."  The other issue is I'm thinking it's battery related, and I would be the Acer tech left the Chromebook plugged in, and I've only experienced the issue while on battery power.Given the above... I've updated my rating to 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Easiest computer I've ever used!
Reviews.Author: Eileen M. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I'm new to Chromebooks, but I was pleasantly surprised by the ease of use and quick start-up time. Having separate profiles for each user helps, too: I don't have to wade through my boyfriend's files to get to my own.The small size and lightness are a plus. I can literally take it anywhere!The only thing I don't like is that I can't do anything offline. Maybe there is a way and I just haven't found it yet, but right now I can only use it where there's a Wi-Fi connection, and that limits what I can do.All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Best $200 spent!
Reviews.Author: Corinne
Reviews.Content: I've had the same laptop since highschool... its old, slow, and clunky. I'm now in grad school and needed a laptop that is quick and lightweight. The Acer C720 Chromebook is PERFECT. It has everything I need to complete my work. I can write papers, research, even print wirelessly. There are tons of apps. I'm so glad I found this affordable chromebook. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great machine
Reviews.Author: Marlin Kisselstein
Reviews.Content: My old XP laptop was moving out of XP support. My wife loves her Kindle Fire and i could see the value of portability but wanted a key board. At first had trouble adjusting to touch pad and so got a mouse, but have adapted to touch pad and use it rather than the mouse. Work with several senior citizen users and suspect they will find Chromebook ideal especially with the web page zoom feature and larger fonts that make pages senior friendly. Outlook transferred transparently with contacts etc.which was huge. Added Hulu, Pandora, Huffpo, local news and weather to bookmark bar which makes navigation slick. Under Apps "File" is somewhat similar to my computer on Windows and will access your portable drives.Sound is good. Blue tooth a bit spotty and will have to play with. Wow is it fast and the quality is great.  .

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook (11.6-inch, 2GB)
Reviews.Author: John Customer
Reviews.Content: It works great, snappy web page loading, can make phone calls from the browser, using the phone calling feature in Google Gmail, orusing Nonoh to make international calls. I should mention that your phone number, which is your Caller ID, in my case my Google Voicenumber, does not get transmitted properly when using Nonoh in browser calls, but does get transmitted properly from Google Voice / Gmail.The Acer C720 Chromebook has a good battery life, its standby consumption is frugal, it recognized and worked fine with the SanDisk32 GB SD card, printing to local files (and SD card) works fine, USB Patriot 8 GB flash drive was recognized, and files were copied to it,PDF files are supported (writing and viewing), I would say it is a very useful machine. For entertainment, Bejeweled (PopCap) is veryenjoyable, good music and sound effects, awesome colors.

Reviews.Title: Great little chromebook
Reviews.Author: K. Haverkamp
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it.  Her old laptop was crashing all the time and she only used it for browsing the internet anyway, so this was perfect.  Starts up fast, is lightweight and slim.  No worries about updates or malware or whatever.  The screen size is good as well - not huge, but not too small.  Love it!  Might get one for myself as well as I'm jealous of her start-up time.Obviously not for people that need to use Word/Excel etc regularly, but that's not the point of this product.  It has Google Docs for anybody that wants to use those types of products.

Reviews.Title: Blown away by the value
Reviews.Author: Scottb8907
Reviews.Content: This little guy is outstanding.  I've been playing with it for about an hour and I'm already in love.  It's about the perfect size, the screen is absolutely fine (read some negative reviews on it), and the speed is more than adequate.  It plays youtube smoother than my I7 powered ASUS laptop, it plays Netflix without endless buffering or stuttering even at full HD.  It also seems to run Pandora very smoothly.  All things that my old Toshiba Netbook had problems with.  It also seems to do better than my ASUS Transformer tablet on all of the above mentioned activities.If you're thinking about getting something for media consumption (Netflix, Youtube, Pandora, etc) this machine will absolutely not disappoint, especially when you consider the price point.

Reviews.Title: Much better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: brit.bunny
Reviews.Content: OMG I am in love with my Chromebook!I had my reservations and a few slight concerns but ultimately once I started putting this device to work I fell in love.Now I hardly use my bigger laptop. The only times I find myself really needing my full laptop is when I need a better word processor or the backlit keyboard for typing essays and reports at night.Other than that this Chromebook can do it all and it has actually made a lot of things more cohesive. I have an android cell phone so once I started using things like Google Drive, tasks, calendar and Docs on my Chromebook it was awesome to see everything syncing between my devices. Even when I go on my bigger laptop, I just login to Google Drive and I can pull up something I was working on before and its all there.One of my main reasons or getting this Chromebook was so I could bring it to school without worrying about breaking it or it getting stolen. It has worked out perfectly for that, It fits nicely in my backpack and the speed that it starts up and shuts down has been awesome for taking notes in class. Also I have found that now I am way more organized. I have everything on my calendar and planned out the way I always needed it to be. I almost never forget assignments or appointments now because everything is synced together. I love this!I also opted to get the 32GB SSD and I am glad I did because the extra space really comes in handy!I haven't noticed any issues at all with speed and the computer never freezes. In fact I really can't think of any issues that I've experienced, none at all.So I am VERY happy I gave this Chromebook a try and I will definitely always have a Chromebook from now on, because they are awesome!

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: L. A. Coley "mrchaplaincoley"
Reviews.Content: We have desktop and Laptops but wanted something small to watch Utube and surf the web with. This fit the bill perfectly! We like it so much I am thinking of purchasing another one for our grandsons to use when they visit. It is capable of doing so much more than what we use it for!

Reviews.Title: Best Chromebook Value Currently On The Market
Reviews.Author: Michael Stenger
Reviews.Content: I've had this Chromebook for 3 months now, so this review is long overdue. When the first ever Chromebook was announced in 2010, I thought it was a stupid idea. A laptop built around only accessing the web? Why would anyone buy that when they can get a similarly priced Windows laptop? Fast forward several years, and Chromebooks have really hit their stride. The Chrome Web Store has really evolved with many apps also working offline (Nice try, Microsoft) and the pricing has gotten down to where I felt it originally should have been.In my opinion, the Acer C720 is the best value currently on the market. I do 95% of my work online, so a Chromebook just makes sense. Plus, since Google owns my soul, errr, I use many Google products, it works out well. I needed something that wasn't top of the line, but could get through a small to medium work load without bogging down under the pressure, and had great battery life. The Acer C720 has exceeded all my expectations, and while I was worried if 2GB of RAM was enough, it's been just fine for my needs.Pros:-Thin profile, feels solid.-Great keyboard for typing. Well spaced, raised keys.-Good, mostly accurate touchpad. Love the multi-touch functions to scroll, open a link in a new tab. Some complain about the touchpad, but I can tell you I've dealt with far worse.-USB 3.0 port, SD card support, HDMI out.-VERY quiet, barely gets warm even after hours of continuous use.-SSD makes boot up, opening files a breeze.-Fast charging.-Battery life lives up to the claims. I typically keep brightness around 1/3, and have gotten 6 hours on a full charge with over 20% of battery life to spare. However, like any other laptop, if you watch a lot of video, expect around half of what Acer claims.Cons:-Speakers are laughable, so make sure you have good headphones handy.-Despite having a matte finish, the screen isn't so great in sunlight. Wish it had a higher resolution, but for $199, I can't really complain!-Headphone jack requires a good amount of force to snap headphones in, but I assume this is to ensure they don't easily come unplugged.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value
Reviews.Author: lucky one
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on many of the tablet-type computers and chromebooks I chose Acer's C720.  I am "over the moon" about this purchase.  The pricing makes it an incredible value, but the ease of transition to this format makes it exceptional.  I would recommend this product to anyone--unless you need to have disc access.  Several reviews noted the keyboard had issues, however, I have found it to be very easy.  It is so light, transportable and fast!  I'm delighted and impressed with this product.

Reviews.Title: Typing this review on the machine right now
Reviews.Author: Bryan Ho
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the instant start when I need to do something fast. The battery life is excellent but of course; the draw back is, if you have no internet access; this would be a machine with no function, but hey, when I clicked the "add to cart" we all knew that. Hence, this is basically a machine that I work web based. So, far, the machine is also stable and I am aligned to what Google has set, this is a stable machine that is used for cloud computing, Hence, if you are into the cloud, this machine is for you. Remember, you NEED good internet access, invest in a Huawei dongle and you will be fine. This is not for gaming, coding, or anything heavy processing. I got this over the rest of the Chromebooks mainly for Haswell, low power consumption and I view pages as a desk top and not mobile which can be a pain. Hope you like this real review.

Reviews.Title: everything Ive read is true
Reviews.Author: Kelly Catron
Reviews.Content: Have had chrome book a few days really enjoying it!! The posts describing the ACER Chromebook were all factual the ones I read!

Reviews.Title: A tablet with a keyboard is basically what this is--if that sounds good to you then I think it is a winner!
Reviews.Author: judy
Reviews.Content: A really nice tablet with a keyboard is basically what this is...AND I LOVE THAT! I was considering for ages buying a Kindle Fire, but I kept waiting and trying to decide if it would do enough to really make me happy. When I saw that this was in the same price point and had a keyboard (so that it was more like a baby laptop) I decided this would be EVEN BETTER! I think I made the right call. I wanted to be able to watch movies, browse the internet, and read Kindle books away from my desktop computer. This is just perfect for all of that, and with the keyboard attached it is good for pretty much everything I use the desktop for except when I need to use MS Office or Adobe graphic programs for school, or play PC based games. So I have my desktop for schoolwork and gaming, and I have this cute little lightweight, easy to set-up and use, FAST, and portable computer for everything else I do on a computer. I am pretty happy! Of course I wouldn't mind a few improvements here and there, so not a 5 star YET (the screen not being great is the biggest complaint I personally have), but really, I am pretty impressed with the concept and execution of a cloud OS.Thanks to all of the great reviews here, BTW! It helped me make a good decision, and I felt like I knew exactly what I was getting before it arrived. Two pieces of advice for people not sure if they would like this or not.***First: Do you have ready access to FAST Wi-Fi? You really need that to be happy, I would think.***Second: Do you use and like the Chrome browser on a PC?? If you do then I think you WILL like this device. If you have never used the Chrome browser TRY IT FIRST. This device totally revolves around the Chrome browser experience.In a nutshell--read up to see see what limitations there are in what you can do (like not using software), and if you can live with those limitations and also like Chrome I'd say: GO FOR IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little machine, for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Rev
Reviews.Content: I installed a larger hard drive in this thing and set it up for Linux, and it's working great.  I can play Civilization 4 smoothly, which is about what I look for in a computer.Only real downside is that the keyboard is a little less fully-keyed than I'm used to (no Home, End, Delete, Page Up or Page Down keys).  I understand why they did it - taking out some keys has permitted a really nice separated-key design, and it IS a chromebook - but I'm very used to using those extra keys.Also, the RAM is soldered in, so make sure this is how much RAM you want.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for everyday student
Reviews.Author: Andre Lee
Reviews.Content: Performs all basic functions efficiently. Access to web based Microsoft powerpoint, excel, and word are available free online at MS's onedrive site. No need to carry battery charger as this lightweight laptop has over 8 hours on full charge. Best of all, it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great for using the internet
Reviews.Author: Eve Shop
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful technology to use and not expensive.  I use it for navigating the internet, watching movies, listening to music, and much more.  Disadvantage is that you can not save files but I already knew this when I purchased it.  Otherwise, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: When it stays on -- its very good at what it does...
Reviews.Author: Brad Corey
Reviews.Content: i have been using the acer c720 for six weeks now.the good:i like it. it works well and, honestly, i cant find anything in terms of productivity that it doesnt do. i use google apps, docs and drive so i do not miss using a downloadable office suite. im in property management and i find that google docs and drive fit my needs very well. i absolutely love how it boots up and is ready to use in approx 4 seconds. i do not miss the annoying and endless start up/shut down and updating of my previous windows 7 laptop.it works smoothly when streaming online shows and movies.it prints very easily from a wireless printer that supports chromebooks. actually that is a big reason i purchased the chromebook and the epson xp-410 printer.the battery is great. i usually plug it in at 10 pm and unplug it at 5 am when i get up and it lasts the duration in between. not bad for a $199 laptop.the not-so-good:in the six weeks i have owned and used the acer c720 chromebook, it has, for no apparent reason, just shut off. it has happened 5 times while streaming online shows and while using google music service. i cant seems to isolate any factors that are causing the issue, but its a little frustrating especially if im watching a cool movie ...and wham..it shuts down. no notice, its just a black screen and i have to boot it back up.the bottom line:other than the unexpected shutting down, i really like the chromebook. i have not decided if i should send the chromebook back because thats such a hassle and its the only computer i now own. because it boots up so quickly it isnt as bad as it could be. nonetheless, if you are considering a chromebook, just be aware that it might have the same sudden shut-off issue mine has. otherwise i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It's awesome!
Reviews.Author: LEEJONGIN
Reviews.Content: It's better than normal $400 laptop!It is optimization on my work.(I'm a student)also, it's keybord's typing feeling is really nice.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice laptop for my college bound daughter. She loves it. It's the right size and serves it purpose.

Reviews.Title: super
Reviews.Author: musicman
Reviews.Content: some say the style is not the best but really this is a very nicelittle system and I expected to find it restrictive in capability but the chrome os is just finefor many things and quite fast. I got a few (3) for each family member to have one ...for theprice of just one windows laptop and for  my casual-use family members it is great!ok...no skype ...but..most of our smart phones can do skype nowadays.

Reviews.Title: Great for surfing
Reviews.Author: John Hammer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my winter home just for guests to check email and surf , it is great for that but a little small so I also purchases the hp chrome book 15 inch ,  my wife will not put it down,

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: char1945
Reviews.Content: I gave this my husband who has very few computer skills.  He loves it.  It was had for me to use, however, because I am used to a pc.

Reviews.Title: Just as expected for the price - 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: Eric Williams
Reviews.Content: SSD with a battery life of 9+ hours is perfect.  I charge it literally only every few days.  With the Google services (drive, print, etc) this is hands down the best purchase laptop wise I have made!

Reviews.Title: My electronic baby!
Reviews.Author: Michele Barber
Reviews.Content: I love my Chromebook. I am not giving clever or exciting reviews today, so just the basics. It loads quicker than anything I have every used, like 5 seconds, bam, you're online! I can do anything on here I can do in Google Chrome, give or take. I can watch Netflix, etc. I use it almost exclusively now instead of my PC.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: brandon sarkis
Reviews.Content: if you know what yure getting in a chromebook, you cant really do any better than this one.  its super slim, very light and has a great keyboard.  the plastics are a tad creaky and the battery is non-removable, but its a great machine for around $200.

Reviews.Title: Very fast and good overall. Keyboard is weak. Attached mouse speed is too slow.
Reviews.Author: Arpad O.
Reviews.Content: It's a really fast machine, I very much like it. The time it takes to be ready to use is incredible, just a mere few seconds.Also the operating speed is very good, thanks to the fast CPU and the SSD (instead of a HDD).KEYBOARDI have one complaint about it: the KEYBOARD.It's only OK. Which means, it is not bad, but it is far from being good.It does not have definite pressure points; you can't feel whether you've pushed the keys down or not.So the keyboard is definitely not good.MOUSEOne more thing you might come across (but this is related to Chrome OS, not this device):If you like fast MOUSE cursor movements, i.e. you are used to that a small mouse movement causes big cursor movement on the screen there is a high chance that your usual mouse will not fit.You have to buy a mouse with at least 1600 DPI sensitivity. I don't recommend Logitech mice since most of them have 1000 DPI and Logitech even doesn't state the sensitivity of their mice.I've managed to buy a cheap no-name Chinese wireless mouse for around $15 which is a 1600 DPI wireless mouse and it works like a charm; it is sensitive and fast enough, and very responsive like a wired one; there is not any lag stemming from the wireless operation.So you have to be sure that the sensitivity of the mouse is at least 1600 DPI. If it is higher that is not a problem -- in the Chrome settings you can decelerate the speed. It's just can't be set to be fast enough with a 1000 DPI mouse.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I needed
Reviews.Author: Angeliki Kyros
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with my purchase!I only needed something for internet searches, email, and the occasional document.(btw google docs -awesome!) I have found I can use it for so much more.Its small but sturdy and well made.Love it :)

Reviews.Title: Was a present to my daughter
Reviews.Author: H. Schubert "honi soit qui mal y pense"
Reviews.Content: My daughter got this Chromebook for use at her freshmen year at college. Because her (old) Apple laptop was aging a bit and too bulky to carry around on campus I looked for an alternative solution. To buy a new Apple system for the college day-to-day seemed for me too expensive as there is always the risk of theft. So initially she was a bit 'disappointed' - however now, after the first month of use she really likes the speed of starting the system up, the availability of features via apps and is not looking for anything else on that unit - of course some compromises she had to accept, being an Apple user for long.The quality is decent - not quite the Apple level, but neither is the price - so for this year I hope the Acer will suffice and we see what might come later. (I personally like the small size and fast startup, too!!)

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mimmees
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my grandson for Christmas. I've is 15 so I wanted him to have his own system. When he opened it his eyes just lit up. Takes great care of it. Was very easy for him to set up too.

Reviews.Title: quiet, fast and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Plant Lover
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook is for my husband to check email, use craigslist and general web surfing. It has fit the bill perfectly.  The screen is small (no surprise) for games, but for everything else, it is a snap. It is totally quiet. After some set up issues (mainly our router needed to be moved), wifi works beautifully.  It is also super fast.

Reviews.Title: greattttttttttttt
Reviews.Author: christopher allen
Reviews.Content: Great product. Shipped fast great connectivity. Arrives as described. However before you get this product make sure you dont need software as this product is not made to access hardware

Reviews.Title: I Am Now a Hero!
Reviews.Author: digidoc664 "digidoc664"
Reviews.Content: I have spent much time helping my wife - who is well educated but not particularly computer literate - resolve concerns with her netbook computer. Recurring problems with CPU speed, software and access to our wireless Local Area Network have led to many discussions with unpleasant outcomes.The Chromebook is instant-On, has very little software to manage (she got use to the Open Source suite provided very quickly), has no difficulty accessing our LAN, and has a standard-sized keyboard that is much easier to use by arthritic fingers.She has respected my ability to solve our computer concern during the past 35 years, but Chromebook has made me a hero!

Reviews.Title: Great and exactly what was advertised.
Reviews.Author: Zach Huxford
Reviews.Content: This is a great, customisable product suitable for entry level buyers. With a little technological intuition one can make this chromebook as functional as a windows laptop. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: lots better than I would expect to get for 200
Reviews.Author: phatgreens83
Reviews.Content: I love this its light weight so that maneuvering is a snap(I can handle it with one hand).Media plays better on this than on my other pcs.no booting time its either on or offeven the mouse pad that people are complain about is really very easy to get the hang of and I find it eons more responsive then the acers I have usedI wouldn't give it 5  just because its mildly annoying that I can only get content from google other than that I would buy this for anyone that just needs a basic unit to watch movies and browse its great for entertainment purposes. For me it has the portability of a tablet with most of the versatility of a computer

Reviews.Title: Really an excellent netbook
Reviews.Author: Max P.
Reviews.Content: I recommend putting Ubuntu Linux on this computer using Crouton if you wish and basically run both OSs in tandem.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook is as advertised
Reviews.Author: whoozabear
Reviews.Content: i wanted something a little smaller than the laptop and was attracted to the Chromebook because of its size and its claim that it didn't get hot.  I use it primarily for playing card games and doing jigsaw puzzles while watching TV however it does much more.  I would give it 5 stars except it does get a little warm but not to the point where it is uncomfortable in my lap.  The email program is better than expected.  It was simple to set up and network.  It is speedy on the internet.  I haven't used the word program yet as I am a little uncomfortable with the cloud but I'm sure I will eventually use it.  Change is hard for me and I still don't like the touchpad so I use a wireless mouse with it and that is somewhat inconvenient because there isn't much room on the keyboard for it....solved that problem by placing a clipboard over the keys.  I haven't timed how long it goes without charging but it is much longer than my laptop.  I have found no problems with it.  The price was right.  It is light in weight. Yes, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: my new product!
Reviews.Author: Claire AcciavattiI
Reviews.Content: love my new lap top! acer is a great product i also have a tablet and i much prefer using  my lap top thank you for your services

Reviews.Title: love my chromebook
Reviews.Author: joseph quaranta
Reviews.Content: I love it.  The only drawback is I cannot operate my adobe programs on it due to its limitations however, I knew that prior to purchasing it. I'd rather have a separate computer for that though because of multiple users surfing on it.

Reviews.Title: I love my chromebook
Reviews.Author: Patricia Giovinazzo "Patty G"
Reviews.Content: I love my chromebook. It's superfast, and great to type on which I wasn't expecting because it's so small. The transfer of word documents to chrome works well, the only thing I noticed was tabs changing. The rest of the formatting was unchanged. The only awkward thing is when you are creating a new document there is no save function, chrome is just saving every few seconds automatically. Once you get used to the changes you'll love it. Also the battery lasts for ages. The laptop synced to my android phone as soon as I completed set up with my gmail address iwas good to go - it took seconds for setup. For the price it can't be beat! My daughter bought a new Asus at the same time as I bought this. She had to buy new Microsoft Office and some other software so she spent more than 3 times the money plus she has to adapt to new Windows as well. Try chromebook!

Reviews.Title: Love my chrome book!
Reviews.Author: J. Jensen
Reviews.Content: This chrome book does everything I expected and does it well. For day to day web browsing and media consumption it's hard to beat the performance of this very reasonably priced device. I've used my windows laptop once since purchasing this chrome book about a month ago. If you are a Google products user, it makes sense and I highly recommend the Acer C720.

Reviews.Title: Huge value in nice, simple package
Reviews.Author: Keeping it Clean
Reviews.Content: Got 2--one for each of my kids (10th and 7th grades).  Better than a tablet if you need to type or really work on something.  Fits in 11-inch computer sleeve.  Charger could be more elegant.  You've got to be okay with Chrome and Google Docs.  Note, to print, you've got to have a cloud-compatible printer.  My HP is too old even though it works wirelessly with my Mac.  So, check out compatible printers if that's vital for you.

Reviews.Title: Printing Problems now fixed
Reviews.Author: Bob Langley
Reviews.Content: The ability to print was an issue till I had inadvertently discovered hp e-print app letting me select by manufacture my wireless printer and now can print through the cloud.  The answers till then ie print by using another computer that is wired to my printer was not working for me.  The 2nd computer needs to be on was just not working for me.I was ready to replace the os with windows till I discovered hp e-print.

Reviews.Title: NO COMPLAINTS
Reviews.Author: VACATION TIME
Reviews.Content: WORTH THE PRICE I PAID..NICE LITTLE EMAIL INTERNET COMPUTER THAT DOESN'T GET FILLED WITH VIRUSES LIKE WINDOWS. I HATE WINDOWS

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop
Reviews.Author: Jonnie
Reviews.Content: Seriously not even gonna write a whole report about this machine, l'm gonna break down to you guys. I've owned Apple and windows laptops, but this one is the one for a college student.

Reviews.Title: Everything I needed
Reviews.Author: Lianne Akers
Reviews.Content: I have been searching for a new laptop after mine finally died. I needed something to supplement my phone and tablet since most mobile websites are limiting and I needed to be able to create and share power points, word docs, etc. I was hesitant at first to try a Chromebook. I wasn't sure how I would complete work projects without having the Office Suite, or how I felt about having to work almost completely online. What I found was that this little device does everything I need it to. I can create and share spread sheets, presentations, and docs using Google. It loads incredibly fast, it's lightweight and compact, and easy to navigate. Plus, I am almost always somewhere with wifi connectivity, so that has really become a non-issue. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Melonie A. Flomer "Writer, gamer, geek. Frien...
Reviews.Content: Responsive, easy to use keyboard and trackpad.  I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift, and now I want one.The only improvement I would suggest is making one with a 14" screen.  Hubby is a tall fellow with large hands, and I am sure he would appreciate a larger Chromebook.  All the high ratings the Acer C720 has received are well deserved.

Reviews.Title: acer c720  great nifty machine for thge price
Reviews.Author: Reuben Pillay
Reviews.Content: The c720 by acer is a great nifty browsing machine. I opened 12 window tabs and had video running in 8 of them. It was all seamless. On only 2GB ram and 16 GB hard drive , it functioned optimally.Totally recommend

Reviews.Title: Love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Langdon "Billy Shears"
Reviews.Content: I had a Nexus but had to prop it up to read the news in the AM.  This is like a 11" iPad that has a built in keyboard.  Oh yeah - for $200.  No hard drive but I don't need it.  I just want to surf.  Oh and it's the fastest computer I've ever used in my life.

Reviews.Title: The best $200 I've spent
Reviews.Author: Tom Carrio
Reviews.Content: Chrome OS was lacking only in the sense of Skype, so I installed Crouton onboard to have a chroot installation of Ubuntu alongside. For what I've paid this is absolutely the best device I could ask for with what I use, which is mostly cloud-based Docs, web-browsing and video calls. Only 16 GB of storage which is great.Note: Had issues trying to install ChrUbuntu. Crouton works perfectly fine and I don't have to ever restart my computer to boot up into Ubuntu either. With only 2GB of RAM I'd suggest against using both OS' heavily simultaneously but I haven't had any issues with this laptop yet at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!  Must have 2nd Computer
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I am not going to dive into tech specs -- its easy to compare those.But from use case perspective, this is my favorite laptop / computer ever.I have my workhorse desktop for actual sit-down work, but I would rather be doing everything on my Acer Chromebook C720.Boots in seconds (sooooooo nice), does everything I need 95% of the time (i.e., obviously don't use for graphic processing), and on the road it is a wonder.  In that almost everything I do is cloud based (Evernote, Google Drive, Gmail, etc.) -- this computer is all you need.  And I love the keyboard.Build is a touch on the lower-cost end, but it is a lower cost computer that I throw in my bag and just go.  If it breaks (which I doubt it ever will) I'll just get another.  And along those lines, I bought 3 of these for co-workers for Christmas -- sharing the love.This is perfect tech - better, cheaper, faster and more usable.Just get it,

Reviews.Title: Amazing way to Compute!
Reviews.Author: k
Reviews.Content: My MacBook pro bit the dust.  Sad day truly...but when considering my options to re-tech my home life, I realized that as fabulous of a product the Apple was, I simply did not use or need all of the Apple specific bells and whistles.  And the idea of a PC saddled with the dreadful Windows 8 was not appealing.  I decided to try a total "in the clouds" option of computing and went with the Acer C720 Chromebook.  I love it!Fast...super fast.  Like lightening!  Like a teenager trying to get out of shoveling a snowy driveway.  Like a seagull stealing cheetos at the beach.  You get the idea.  Open the Chromebook and faster than I can blink it is up and running and ready for action.  The App selection in the Chrome Store is not as broad as Apples but there was everything that I used frequently prior to the tragic demise of my MacBook.  Extremely simple to use and understand, but I can totally see where the "in the clouds" approach is going to be even more functional and secure than a hard drive.  ALSO I spend hours with this running on my lap and it doesn't heat up.  (Whereas my MacBook left red burn marks on my legs if I didn't have it on a board.)The only caveat for the Acer...the screen quality leaves a little bit to be desired.  It is not crystal clear and sharp.My daughter's Dell laptop is physically falling apart but still functioning well...(eight years running so no complaints)...when the Dell goes I am replacing it with another Chromebook.  How can you go wrong with $199 machine that does it all?

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the middle school student
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A Brunner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter.  She loves it for school, social media, and watching Netflix. We like the fact that we don't have to have virus software and that the updates are automatic. Works great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought this in order to replace a 2010 Macbook Pro. After the logicboard failed, I was not interested in dropping another $1200 on a computer. This thing really works well, the touchpad is great, and is surprisingly fast. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an internet cruising computer, or even small word processing projects.

Reviews.Title: Opinion of Acer C720 laptop
Reviews.Author: twyla
Reviews.Content: The mouse cursor is hard to move and stay on the spot that you are wanting information and the keys are hard to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: april cronenberg
Reviews.Content: As long as you are looking for a chrome book and not a work machine, this little guy is perfect. And as a bonus, the speakers are quite loud!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product for a great price
Reviews.Author: Bakul Mehta
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop for my wife. Her major work is to browse the interenet and check emails. I bought 2G version. It is thin, lightweight and fast. It is similar to a smartphone but with a large screen, keyboard and full blown browser. Since it uses intel's haswell architecture CPU, provides battery life of almost 10 hrs. Truly love it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value for money
Reviews.Author: S douglas
Reviews.Content: This little laptop was a present for my kid. It is the fastest computer in the house. Starts up really quickly. Meets all our computer expectations

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this Chromebook
Reviews.Author: M. Joppru
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook is awesome.  For $200 it is much better than any other laptop I have for browsing the web.  It boots up in seconds, feels substantial and is really fast.It can be used to view and modify spreadsheets and ppts too.I don't think it can replace a destop / laptop for me completely yet, but I am using it for almost everything.

Reviews.Title: I love Amazon
Reviews.Author: Teresa Delgado
Reviews.Content: I love this computer it comes with virus protection and it is very easy to use. I got it for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Really greate device for this price.
Reviews.Author: ZHAN CHENXING
Reviews.Content: Advantages:1. The price.2. The touchpad is really greate. You don't need a mouse. Two fingers to scrool, three or four fingers to switch tab. You don't need to take a mouse around with you.3. It's fast. It's as fast as my two years old Macbook.4. It boots fast. In about 7 seconds.5. The input method is really greate.Disadvantages:1. The screen! It will be a perfect device if it has a better screen.2. The font for chinese is not as good as Macbook's.3. The charger is a little big, I think.4. The keyboard is somehow soft.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: JGJoy
Reviews.Content: Small, light, fast, good battery life, great display, does what I need -- exceeded my expectations.I've used the remote desktop via the chrome browser to access a windows 7 computer without issues.I've used developer mode and crouton to run some Ubuntu shell scripts on the box itself (also using dict/dictd on cli).Fine with external mouse.  Keyboard is good.A little effort required to find things like keyboard shortcuts ("delete" key is actually Alt-Backspace, e.g.,) and instructions for odds and ends, but unsurprisingly, Google search results have been on target and quickly got me what I needed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Jon "Jon"
Reviews.Content: Okay, I spent weeks, no months laboring over whether to replace my laptop (monitor no longer works) with another windows based laptop or go Chromebook.  I am already heavily entrenched into the Google ecosystem and consequently the Chromebook was a big draw.  For those not quite entrenched in Google, I can understand why a Chromebook may not be as appealing.Let me be clear:  I already have a work windows based laptop that I can do various things if necessary.  What I mainly needed was something to more easily type long emails, etc on.  We mainly use it for the internet and doing more robust web browsing when the android tablet just won't quite cut it.  The Chromebook fits the bill to the "T"!One review I saw about windows based laptops vs Chromebooks that i agree with: Chromebooks do not need as robust hardware because they don't have the heavy and complicated windows software that needs a fast processor to operate.  2 gig RAM is more than enough.  And the Haswell based processor is plenty zippy and keeps the laptop running for days for me with periodic use.The selling point for me?  Once I realized I can access my old laptop with my Chromebook using Google's "Chrome Remote Desktop", I was in business.  This way I can access my windows laptop and my keystrokes on my Chromebook control my old windows based laptop and my old laptop sends the screen to my Chromebook's monitor.  It then looks like on my Chromebook that I'm working on my old laptop.All for $199, half of a new windows-based laptop?  How can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: Great appliance for web browsing
Reviews.Author: Helen S. Lam
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas, I got the kids a Kindle Fire.  This year, I got them this Chromebook.  It's a great alternative to a tablet as it has a keyboard to enable typing and document creation.  No set-up is necessary, I just turned it on and boom I am on the web in seconds!  The launcher at the bottom is a nice feature to add your favorite apps for a quick launch.  It's just one click to launch the webcam.  I really like cloud computing as it allows me the flexibility of creating a document at work and then accessing and revising it home  without needing to send it via email and worry about multiple copies and versions.The only drawback to this Chromebook are printing and projecting the Chromebook onto my TV.  Unless you have a Cloud Print compatible printer, you would need to connect your classic printer to cloud print using your PC/laptop (Google these terms for setup instructions).  Once these are set up, using your Chromebook, you can virtually queue your documents to this cloud print queue.  If your PC/laptop is on and connected to your printer, it will print out your documents.  Since I have a laptop that is not permanently connected to my printer, I would need to fire up my laptop and connect it to the printer to print these documents.  So,  there is little advantage of using the Chromebook.  I may as well just use my laptop and print from it!Additionally, projecting the Chromebook to my TV using a HDMI cable is not intuitive.  Even after many tries, the projected screen on the TV is not fully extended to fit the size of my TV.  I am buying Chromecast to see whether the projection would be easier.It's overall a good machine especially if you mainly use it for quick web browsing (it boots up much faster than a PC/laptop) or document creation.  It would be great if I can just plug the Chromebook to my printer and directly print!

Reviews.Title: Great speed, good trackpad, excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: Paul Spoerry "Paul"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my girlfriends aging 17" HP laptop. It was heavy and so hot that you had to use a lap cooler (which made it even more heavy to lug around). When she told me she wanted a Chromebook I was skeptical and kept re-iterating that it wasn't a "real laptop".I am SO GLAD I bought this for her; she loves it. It's a lot quicker than I expected it to be and it holds up well under all her tabs (she's a tab-a-holic). The keyboard has good action and the trackpad is easy to use... not as nice as my older Macbook Pro but still better than my Dell XPS. Since most everything is web based and you're given a generous amount of Google Drive space the 16GB SSD doesn't feel cramped. Best of all it's super light and portable so she's very comfortable moving around the house with it. Battery life is pretty awesome as well so she doesn't feel the need to constantly reach for a charger. It's so impressive that I'm on a waiting list to get one myself.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 is Ace
Reviews.Author: Dan Bridge
Reviews.Content: Love this machine. For the price it ticks all the boxes and more. Great battery life, small, light, durable and the best trackpad of any machine I've used or owned. I'm using this in preference to my tablet.Nice one Acer, you've aced it.

Reviews.Title: Ease to set up and use
Reviews.Author: Theresa L Landtiser
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my retired husband so he didn't have to keep going to the back of the house to do research on the computer.  Can't get him off of it, he LOVES this device.  This has turned him into a multi-tasker too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Craftsmanship
Reviews.Author: M. Barlow "X400"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a christmas gift for my cousin but I checked the device out before wrapping it and it is extremely well made, the exterior may look a little on the cheaper side but the moment the device is in your hand WOW it feels premium and there is a slight heft to it that just oozes quality! Acer craftsmanship top notch as always.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Margaret Cullen Lambe
Reviews.Content: Great machine for travel.  Easy on and off.  Battery life is 8 hours.  Haven't used my laptop since I received this machine.  I don't miss IE since I do more surfing than computing.

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: Connie Radke
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 21 year old son who is in premed school. He has a laptop and a tablet but wanted something smaller to carry around to class that he could easily write his papers on. This works perfectly for this.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Boyd
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my elderly mother for Christmas because any kind of Windows OS is too much for her (I still haven't figured out why!). This is much easier for her to use. It's very lightweight. I think it's an excellent alternative to a regular laptop when no software ever needs to be installed. I'm a gamer, so this laptop would NEVER work for me personally. But for someone like my mom with limited usage who only uses facebook, gmail and the occasional web-based game, absolutely. I also think the price is very reasonable. Had it up and running in less than 10 minutes, only a few seconds of which was boot time. The rest was just me connecting to the router, setting up email, etc. Perfect fit for my mom.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: Peter Chen
Reviews.Content: Knowing that if I bought a windows laptop, I'd probably end up browsing youtube, reddit, gmail, mindless surfing, google+ photos editing 95% of the time, why not just save $100+ and get a chromebook. Boy was that a good decision. I have a desktop with a beast of a cpu, a fast gpu, and a massive monitor, I really don't need that windows/mac laptop. If you're a student that's not in the field of math and engineering, this is a good machine to have. There are even web-based IDE for programming. Still waiting on the Arduino IDE, though.Even without a linux install (which is super easy with this gen of chromebook) this is a very productive device. System is very responsive. The boot up time isn't 7 seconds - more like 4 seconds. All settings are saved, so there's no worry of having your chromebook wiped. It's also super easy to share your laptop with other, just have them logging using their google account.All in all, I wouldn't get this chromebook if you don't have another powerful machine. But on the other hand, if you want a super lightweight linux laptop that's cheap, this is the option.

Reviews.Title: Great Unit....!
Reviews.Author: JBB
Reviews.Content: Well...I had purchased this Unit as a XMas Gift for my GF being her Laptop is a Dog and she has said only Positive things so far about this Chromebook !  She loves the Speed being this is what she was lacking on her Laptop. Yes she still uses her Laptop for many things that this Chromebook can Not do (ie...Optical Drives, Etc...) but for Surfing, Email, Etc....it's Defintely the way to go ! I am sure there is More, but being the Holiday was only a couple weeks ago this is all I got so far, but like I said...she loves it ! So IF you are in the Hunt for something small, light, compact, fast, etc and Not looking to spend a Arm & Leg...I highly Reco this Unit !

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: K. Dangos "kokoko"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Tobshiba laptop with this one. I like the Chrome set up. Windows 8 is not my favorite. I only need a laptop for wireless internet surfing, Facebook, selecting my movies from Netflix, email and other simple functions. There are ways to work around not having MS Office on it. I login into my Skydrive account on MSN and you have apps to use for that. If I need to work from home, I can use my worklap top. Nice size, its very light and the battery has a very long charge time. I took the time to learn what Chrome can do and get familiar with keyboard short cuts. I also like the price.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my Windows PC for Good!
Reviews.Author: Clint J. Zephir
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what I need without all the extra garbage that comes with a windows laptop. Love how it turns on in seconds and how I don't have to reboot to upgrade. Many more things available offline than were known before I purchased this. Very glad I did!

Reviews.Title: Great little "laptop"
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: This is a great little unit. Really quick, super light and charges quickly. I am going to dual boot and use Fedora 20 on this as well but would still be a great unit using chrome -- which I am starting to like more and more. Just needs a few more chrome apps for me to get all gushy. Well worth the bucks, a great little performer.

Reviews.Title: Happy 10 and 12 year olds
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: Bought these for our girls...we were worried as we are mostly apple users, but they love them so far! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great little machine!
Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Chromebook as a gift for my fiance. So far, so good! He loves it. It's user-friendly, incredibly easy to set up, and much faster than our clunky old laptop. I highly recommend the Chromebook, particularly if, like us, you primarily use your laptop to access the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Great for it's intended purpose
Reviews.Author: J. Huff "Engineer @ Large"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband, who mostly surfs the iinternet, checks email, and uses instant messenging.  He has never used any OS other than Windows, but right out of the box with very little fuss he got this set up and running in about 30 minutes, which is worth 5 stars all on it's own.  For what he uses a laptop for, this is perfect.  Was also somewhat slimmer and morelightweight than I had realized, which is another nice benefit.

Reviews.Title: High school student present
Reviews.Author: LaraLorraine
Reviews.Content: She loves it because it's small, light weight, and easy to pack.  She's already using Google Docs for school instead of packing around disks.  Now I get my own computer! mawahah

Reviews.Title: Looking for a 4GB model
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "hanulec"
Reviews.Content: goto acer.com and see the complete list of possible models available.  i just picked up a C720P 4GB ram 16GB ssd -- model C720P-2625

Reviews.Title: mostly positive
Reviews.Author: alvin c ruppert
Reviews.Content: Had several successes--chromecast, google docs--but printing continues to be a problem.  Unfortunately, I still need a Windows machine for special programs.

Reviews.Title: love this!!!
Reviews.Author: marnie
Reviews.Content: I am not very technologically savvy, so why has it taken me so long to get a chromebook...  I absolutely love this, and wish I bought this a long time ago.

Reviews.Title: I use this every day...
Reviews.Author: christian
Reviews.Content: I was already a Google fan with their apps on my moto x phone. 7 sec bootup and syncing up with my google account just makes my life easier. I got it on Cyber Monday with a great price. I recommend to get a external drive and google chromecast. I barely use my other laptop.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Happy with this Chromebook! (Except for keyboard)
Reviews.Author: R. Toro "Tech Junkie"
Reviews.Content: Although I am a heavy user of Android and Google services, I waited a long time before buying a Chromebook. The concept intrigued me since they were originally released, but I wasn't sure that a Chromebook would be enough to fit my needs.  After a lot of research that included reading many reviews, I finally jumped in and got one.  I could not be more pleased! This particular model is a great value, and for web browsing and email reading, it is perfect. The battery life is really good (over 6 hours depending on usage), and it is really light!This is not a regular Windows computer, so you should be sure that you understand that before buying it so that you aren't disappointed. But for general Internet, email, Youtube, Facebook, etc, this is a great device. And with the Google offline apps, it can be used for word processing, taking notes, and other functions.My only complaint is that the keyboard has those flat keys that look like chicklets, which makes it more difficult to type because you can barely feel where one key ends and the next begins. Plus, the keys don't feel very durable. However, most of the use I plan on giving it involves web browsing with limited typing, so it shouldn't be a problem. But if you are a blogger or plan on typing a book on this, make sure you try the keyboard at a store before you buy...

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Dawn M Merriman
Reviews.Content: Love how fast it starts up! Easy to use. GREAT GREAT GREAT and the price is right! Battery is charged for 8.5 hours! Light and easy to carry around with you.

Reviews.Title: great netbook repalcement
Reviews.Author: Rob W.
