Reviews.Content: This is my favorite machine. Light and thin...I hardly use my desktop anymore. Love the fast boot...6 seconds. The touch pad is very responsive. Much better than my Lenovo at work.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: GWW "wood worker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer because it gives me the opportunity to connect with a HDMI to my TV and stream things from the internet. It is great as a laptop computer provided you like the Chrome browser and have WIFI. Does all I expected and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great machine
Reviews.Author: Mike Roach
Reviews.Content: Delivered on time as promised by Amazon. It took less than a minute to get it unboxed and connected to my network. Added a few apps from the Google store and found this device to be an excellent replacement for my aging MSI Wind U100.  This is not a replacement for my laptop but certainly meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Perfect first computer for 6th grader
Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 6th grader and she loves it, there are limitations as to what you can do with it, definitely not a windows or mac computer.  But, for what she needs it for, for the money and for a kids first computer it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop! This is not a Windows type computer!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Go Steelers!"
Reviews.Content: Chromebooks may not be for everybody, but this one works for me.  This is not the Windows type computer you grew up with. You cannot download office, or install any app other than what is in the Chrome OS app store. Don't complain you have been warned. That being said I love this laptop and OS!I'm in sales and typically work out of my home, so for many reasons I use a Windows desktop. When I'm on the road I will travel with my tablet and for the most part that was all I needed. However there are still a few things that are still cumbersome to use on a tablet, that being excel and powerpoint presentations. I wasn't all that psyched about buying another laptop due to cost, and the whole Chrome OS thing intrigued me. The price was worth giving it a shot, if I hated it then I wasn't out that much.I am 100% satisfied with my Acer C720. The boot up speed is unbelievable, less than 7 seconds. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hardware. The keyboard is very nice with little give, and the track pad is fine. I've never been a big fan of laptop track pads, and would say this preforms like all others I've used. Not great, not bad, use a mouse.The Haswell processor handles all tasks thrown at it quickly and without lag, and the battery life is amazing. I have yet to run out, but I would estimate a solid 7-8 hours of constant use.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook!!!! I Love You!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Platt "lotows"
Reviews.Content: Says it all, I love this thing!  This is so fast to surf with, simple to set up, Instant on, sturdy build, It's no computer but I can do everything I need to on or off line. 32gb sd card holds my movies for trips . Yes, Bill Gates,  I love this thing!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: jcbl
Reviews.Content: If the capabilities of a Chrome OS computer are sufficient for you....as they are for the vast majority of users...you cannot go wrong with this machine.  Keyboard feel is excellent and quick start from boot is really nice.  It's instant start from sleep.At the price it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great for internet use!
Reviews.Author: ERIC R PRINCE
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook has been great.  It boots up super fast, and is so small and light you can take it anywhere.  Great for internet use!

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop at this price
Reviews.Author: Izabel
Reviews.Content: The screen isnt bad, and I watch tv on it everyday. Its very sturdy almost like a Thinkpad so i take it everywhere with me. It is a bit slow and loading pages like Amazon arent as fast as I wish they would be, but im used to using a MacBook Pro, so its not really fair to compare:).I use Google apps like Mail, Calendar, Docs, Drive to collaborate on documents with others, and mange my business, shop, and watch tv. I use this for everything I do in Chrome, which seems to be most things. So it really meets most my requirements. Its insane how little this costs, and how high quality it is. Its just nice enough and fast enough that I can really live with this everyday.If I need to do design or dev work, I dont have the expectation to use this, and use a Mac instead.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the classroom!
Reviews.Author: Aeryn
Reviews.Content: I'm a teacher and I purchased this to use as the computer for streaming videos, showing power points, and monitoring behavior. Once I got the adapter to connect to the 11 year old projector in my room, everything works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: What a value!
Reviews.Author: Joe T
Reviews.Content: If you don't need Microsoft this computer does it all.  Great battery life.  Good sound.  I just love it. Like a tablet with a keypad

Reviews.Title: Delivered on its promises.
Reviews.Author: FRANK M OCONNELL
Reviews.Content: Great for all your Internet browsing; very light and portable; fast start up; and no viruses.  Easy to take anywhere.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: CCE
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little product.  It can;t replace my laptop for work as we run too much proprietary software.  For home however it is amazing.  Can keep in your lap for hours with no added heat.  Very light and battery lasts for like 8 hours.  Screen is crystal clear and the sound is decent.  Boots very fast and comes out of hibernation before the screen is open.  Everything is fast and easy

Reviews.Title: Quick and Simple
Reviews.Author: laurent
Reviews.Content: Starts up real quick. Once you sign in with your google account it automatically syncs everything up. Very nice display, I can go outside without having to worry about the glare on the screen. The only bad thing is I can't download any pc games. Other than that the computer is superb.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm not technically enclined at all.  I read alot of reviews about the ACER Chromebook, when it said that all you have to do is open it and you can began, it is the truth.  I opened, signed in with my goole account information and off to the internet I went.  Looks nice, works fast.  If your looking for a neat little notebook this is it.

Reviews.Title: Fast
Reviews.Author: Kedar
Reviews.Content: Extremely fast to boot / browse -- everything.Battery life is ridiculous. I get about 7-8 hours out of this thing.Will be instaling chrubuntu on it soon.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop.
Reviews.Author: John Colpitt
Reviews.Content: Purchased this a second machine for web based tasks. Love the portability and the battery life. If I had a to say something critical it would be that I wish the speakers weren't under the machine. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a secondary computer.

Reviews.Title: Chrome book
Reviews.Author: ABQ NM
Reviews.Content: My grand-daughter loves this laptop. She received it as a Christmas gift. We could not decide if a tablet or laptop would be more appropriate and I know we made the right decision buying this Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Serves its purpose
Reviews.Author: IcexAngel
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop fairly quickly because I was in a bind and had no access to my main PC.  It has helped me out in a pinch but creating and editing office documents has been challenging.  But I realize that this is not what it is specifically designed for so I'll deal with it for now.

Reviews.Title: Good price and does the job.
Reviews.Author: Stephen M.
Reviews.Content: Great for doing my school work. Good size and light weight. Fast internet and word processing. Does the job.maa

Reviews.Title: Works great but there are currently some software limitations to be aware of.
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Everything is great except for the following few items.  The video playback is horrible.  It would be nice to be able to watch some videos from a flash drive when internet is unavailable.  I'm unsure of the politics that would go into this but hopefully a VLC app/extension will be available soon.  The quickoffice app that is used to open .doc files doesn't allow for many options including the ability to add notes or comments to a document.  I know this is possible in most Google docs I have worked on so there may be a way to save it and reopen as a google doc or something.On the plus side:  The battery lives up to expectations.  The speakers are by no means great but they are better than I had expected and I find it tolerable listening to music on them.In summary, the only drawbacks are due to the software all chromebooks have.  I am glad I purchased this model of chromebook.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: lynne doss
Reviews.Content: It is perfect size. Very quick to respond. Allows me to get facebook emails and watch movies.can take any where.

Reviews.Title: My babies love it
Reviews.Author: shanisha hughes
Reviews.Content: My 7 and 9 year old is familiar with using Chrome books any way from school it gives them the same educational learning as school has to offer

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Hasrouji
Reviews.Content: For the price of it and as for what it does, this item is excellent. It works just fine, and is fast and powerful. I had to send it back because I thought it had a touch screen, and it wasn't . It was a Christmas present and it had to be the right one. I got the same one with a touch screen which was $100, more expensive

Reviews.Title: No surprises
Reviews.Author: Deserae Hall
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook was exactly what I thought it was. My 13 year old daughter really likes it for what she does.

Reviews.Title: Fast, light but lacks applications
Reviews.Author: Old and in the way
Reviews.Content: I love how fast it boots up, but as I try to duplicate the programs on my old Windows machine I a slightly disappointed.  No Google Earth, but it is a Google os machine.  The spreadsheet app won't recognize Open Office spreadsheets.  Still, I am bent on moving to the cloud and hate the way Windows machines get slower every year.  I think I will learn to live with this machine,  Great battery life and boots in seconds.

Reviews.Title: Great For Casual Use!
Reviews.Author: rowanne
Reviews.Content: I picked this out for my mom and she loves it! It's very lightweight and small so it's perfect for traveling, but good for regular use as well because the screen isn't tiny. It's got a very minimal desktop setup, and very easy to understand settings and controls for even the most inexperienced users. Word of advice: don't get this if you're looking for anything other than a very minimal computer- it doesn't really even have any basic programs on it and is pretty much useless without the internet, although it does come with a decent webcam. My mom only really ever uses her computer for the internet which is pretty much what this was made for. The only real con I found is that some accessories for it (like hard cases) are hard to come by because it's a new model I guess. It's a good gift for anyone who just wants to go online.

Reviews.Title: Very good, at what it is designed to do
Reviews.Author: R. Stenerson
Reviews.Content: If you can get one for the list price, this is a very good purchase.  It is great at anything you can do in the Chrome browser.  Fast boot and on from standby, easy updates, and long battery life.  It won't replace a laptop or desktop for me, but it is not meant do.

Reviews.Title: College Student
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Performs great! I do everything through the internet so this fits my needs exactly. Its portable, fast, smooth, and has great battery life. Although others might disagree, I actually like the design of this Chromebook. It's sleek and professional. I doubt there is a windows laptop for 199$ that can perform as well as this Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: It exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: CAlpizar
Reviews.Content: It exceeded my expectations. This little computer stays cool always, it does not seem to heat. It is extremely fast, has a great design and works great for personal use. I can even use it for work if I use the remote desktop client for Chrome.Best mini laptop I ever had.

Reviews.Title: VERY inexpensive way to bring my work with me everywhere.
Reviews.Author: Sheila M. Smith
Reviews.Content: I just got this too (I bought the case I reviewed to go with this chrome book). I have learned a lot since my first purchase of a windows machine. I like this. It utilizes the cloud and my data. I bought a warranty that insures that I have a working machine for 2 years. That's less than 20 bucks a month to be able to take my work everywhere. That's a friggin' bargain! I wish I could let you know about how this works during my work on the road, but hey, you know WHY I purchased it by my review and based on that, it's 5 stars already.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Maxwell
Reviews.Content: Very good for the cost. I was extremely impressed by the speed and build quality. Would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Winner
Reviews.Author: Rob Sanger
Reviews.Content: Wow, it packs a ton of productivity into a $199 price. If you are a google user you will find it easy to use and the best value in computing.

Reviews.Content: Do not believe what google says, you need the 4GB ram version to get  smooth streaming video on the chromecast.  below is the email exchange form googleMy email google email is below, also with my actual laptop with windows and 4GB of ram I have no issues streaming or if I stream from my phone on one of the approved apps. Reviews.Title: After some tweaks it can get 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This chromebook is great - lightweight, small and thin. I bought it to write some stuff, but didn't realize there is no proper app in Chrome Store. So what I'm giving 3 stars is only a ChromeOS - it's really restricted and underpowered. The hardware is at least 4 stars (it feels a little bit plasticy).I bought a netbook I couldn't write on. I decided to do something about that and installed different linux (elementary) - it was kinda painful since Google makes it as hard as possible- and after the whole proces I can strongly recommend device and even give it a 5 star. If acer only could sell it without any system with simple BIOS access...

Reviews.Title: Mixed thoughts
Reviews.Author: eastcoast
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for an inexpensive, portable computer. I have an older desktop that was starting to die slowly and didn't want to plunk a lot of money down on a laptop.  After just barely using it for a day or two,  I noticed a huge surge in my data plan (I was using it on my cell phone  hotspot).  Turns out you can't turn off the updates and I quickly learned that if you are using this on limited data, the data use will be too big.  Plus, you don't have a way of knowing how big or small the update will be. It just does it in the background.  So, if you have to watch your data (like I do), it's risky if you are close to your data limit for the month.  As much as people are cutting cords now and dropping paying for full internet at home like I did, this should be fixed if Google wants this to be a good option.  However, if you are using it on your unlimited wifi, it would be great.  It booted up super fast and was much faster than my desktop.  I have mixed feelings. I think the concept is great, but I needed to be able to control auto updates. I hear that will not be an issue later, but for now it might has well been unusable for me.  Thankfully, the seller had a very gracious return policy (Acer Outlet).

Reviews.Title: Could be a great little machine
Reviews.Author: Mr. Zoo "zooeytug"
Reviews.Content: I like almost everything about this machine: the size, the speed at which it starts up, the style (especially for this price point), and the weight.What's bad about it is its inability to connect to internet consistently which for a machine that needs to be connected to the internet to work properly and efficiently, this is a big problem. It just can't connect are a regular basis, especially when the battery is under 80%. I have laptops, cell phones, consoles, and PCs that all do fine on this network  but the Acer C720 just can't compete with those. While the other devices are connected and surfing properly, this machine will drop the connection a lot. Occasionally it will have a nice little run and not drop connection for a day, but that is a rarity.BTW: I've dealt with Customer Service (both ACER CS and a internet forums for Chrome, google, and general hardware) and haven't had much luck getting it fixed. I like the machine in every other aspect but this.

Reviews.Title: Nice for Seniors or Beginners
Reviews.Author: SUTHRN1
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for an older family member. He likes it, but its a bit small for his sight. Overall, its nice and light and great for a beginner or someone who doesn't have a lot to do on a computer.

Reviews.Title: Internet dependent, but adequate
Reviews.Author: martie buzzard
Reviews.Content: It is adequate and easy to operate but it is internet dependent.  Some conversions of documents and excelSpreadsheets don't work well.

Reviews.Title: For what it is, it performs exceptionally well.
Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: If I were outfitting a nursing home or a kindergarden with laptops for all the residents, these are the laptops I would purchase (The newly bred and the nearly dead do have quite a bit in common).  But even for us inbetweeners, this laptop does offer a few attractive features as well.These features are the same for all of us regardless of age; the tendencies that we as individuals have for blaming our human errors on the equipment we are using.  This laptop takes simple to a completely new level where if something gets screwed up you will know it was your fault regardless of age.The Chromium OS also takes away the confusion of choosing the feature set of laptops that many times scares those who do not understand them.  Not only is this laptop using a dated processor and very limited other hardware offerings, however due to the operating system the user is left to wait for the hardware to catch up.As Google is now offering a decent set of cloud "Office" replacements, the user will benefit greatly if they hop on the bandwagon because never again will you be cursing a Windows freeze or a kernel panic for losing the entire document you were typing before the computer screwed it up.  The continuous saving of work product is very embraceable because it doesn't require any additional steps and feels just normal.Now for what this computer cannot do yet: Networking!  If the chromium system would allow for easy networking of computers I can see a business embracing these as everything saved can be shared in a common cloud drive.  The lack of software however makes this an impossibility.It is what it is, and if you want an inexpensive computer and don't do much else than use it for e-mail, internet, and office-type applications this computer is worth a serious look.  I need the features this computer does not have however, so I use it as a coffee table laptop for visitors who just want to check their mail or a sports score.

Reviews.Title: Limited OS
Reviews.Author: dreaming90
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that the machine itself is very nice.  It's light, it's sleek, and battery life is fantastic.  My only complaint about the machine is that it does not have a caps lock key.  I don't have to type in all caps very often but when I do, holding shift is a pain in the butt.  I don't see the logic behind removing the caps lock key, but I suppose someone got paid good money to come up with the idea...It is a shame that a nice machine is so limited by the castrated Chrome OS.Now, there are plenty of warnings regarding the fact that a chromebook uses online apps.  I understood that.  However, there is 16 GB free on the hard drive, so I figured that there must be offline apps in the chrome store.  I live in a rural area where internet access is spotty in many places, so if I wanted to edit a text or image file, I would be able to do so.  I also thought I would be able to store and listen to some music.  Not a lot, obviously, but some to keep me occupied if I was in an area where there was no wifi.  I was also hoping for some light, offline games.So I head over to the chrome store... and there isn't much.  The selection, even for online apps, is small.  When you install an online app, chrome simply puts a site-specific launcher in the menu.  The game section if the store is particularly heart-wrenching, because many of the games don't even work on light hardware such as this.  I knew something was suspicious when I saw apps that had complex, 3D graphics.  It's as if Chrome just puts links in the store without bothering to check if they even work.  Many games do not even exist anymore.  If you want games, you're stuck with cartoonish multiplayer games, such as you would find on Facebook.This would not be a huge problem in and of itself... except, Android is so much more functional.  I have a generic Android device that I spent $30 for on black Friday.  It has many offline apps, a USB keyboard that makes it feel like a netbook, and battery life is even longer.  It is also more customizable as far as appearance goes.  With Chrome OS, all you can really do is change the background.So, while this chromebook was cheap, I could have spent even less and gotten a much more functional device.  It's pretty sad.  I can't even use Tor on my chromebook, and with the recent scandals surrounding internet anonymity, I view this as a flaw.Now, all this being said, there are so pro's to the way ChromeOS functions.  Since everything is in the cloud, if the OS is damaged in any way, the Chrome recovery tool will fix everything up in a no time, and all your data will be safe in the cloud.My biggest feeling with ChromeOS... disappointment.  Google could have created a more traditional OS and swept Microsoft aside.  Linux is incredible and the open source community is vast, and many applications that compete with Microsoft apps already exist.Instead, all I got was a netbook that runs the Chrome browser.  That is literally all ChromeOS is, a glorified browser.It is possible to install Linux on a chromebook, but there are problems with the touchpad.  Furthermore, installing another OS entails entering developer mode, where a scary boot screen stating that the OS is damaged appears with every boot.  The screen advises you to press a certain key to repair the OS... which will wipe your entire Linux install.  With a single keystroke.  Not a big deal if you know what you are doing, but if some unsuspecting friend booted your machine and read the message, you can kiss your data goodbye.If you do most of your stuff online, ChromeOS is fine, if you like paying more for less.  Otherwise, steer clear.

Reviews.Title: Great hardwear.  Terrible OS.  Zero support.
Reviews.Author: JB123
Reviews.Content: Let me give Acer kudos for somehow building a sleek, fast, light and ergonomically pleasing machine at an incredible price point.  And that is the end of the good news.Beyond the physical hardware itself I find nothing useful about the Chromebook design at all.  I did not expect the Chromebook to replace my full blown Windows or Linux PC's.  I did, however, expect to be able to do a few key activities.1.  I use gmail for business and personal email as do many people I know.  On a Windows machine I can look at both account easily by using 2 different browsers and being looged in to each gamil account in a different browser.  Chrome OS IS the browser so you log into the machine using your gmail account.  To Look at another gmail account your have to log out and log into the machine as a different user.  This got old after the first hour of use.2.  Let kids play games and browse with some limitations.  As far as gaming online goes this chrome OS appears to be useless.  When my kid is using this machine I am getting called to assist every 2 minutes because some plugin is required and is either not supported by chrome or has crashed.  Playing exact same online games on a Windows PC works fine 90% of the time.  On Chrome OS is works 10% of the time.3.  Remote desktop.  It does not work.  Period.  I am technically adept and must use VPN clients to access remote machines for my job every day.  Chrome simply does not support VPN.  I tried very hard to get this to work and will not devote my time to elaborate on details here.  Suffice to say Chrome's remote desktop is not an option for me and VPN does not work.I wanted this Chromebook concept to work for me and I tried hard to make it work.  Chromebook as a concept does not provide myself or my family with what we need.  My simple Android tablet provides more flexibility and options than Chromebook does for basic email and browsing.Regarding support:  there is none.  I called and was told as much by Acer.  You are on your own.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Initial setup crippled for MAC filtered wireless
Reviews.Author: Hugh Phillips
Reviews.Content: Once setup and connected this device is awesome.  You can read plenty of other reviews that will attest to that and why.  I have to dock a star because the initial setup is impossible if all that is available to connect to is a MAC filtered wireless network as we have in our home.  The wireless MAC number for this device is not listed on the box or the device itself and the setup screen does not allow any exit to determine what the MAC number is (the Continue button is inactive even if 'No network' is selected).  So - the MAC number of the device cannot be determined so it cannot be put in the wireless access point MAC filter table to allow it to connect.  Chat with Acer tech support was useless - they offered suggestions that will not work to determine the MAC address until at least one connection has been made or using keystroke combinations including Function keys that do not exist on the device.In the end we went to our local library where there is wireless access but no MAC filtering.  Connection was instantaneous and at that point the network icon (lower right of screen) became visible and usable to determine the MAC address.  So then we could go  back home, feed that into the MAC filter table and we were golden at home, too.  An alternative that might have worked was a  direct wired ethernet connection - the Acer does not have this but using something like a Plugable USB ethernet adapter would probably work to get past the initial setup screen.

Reviews.Title: OK machine, horrible WiFi antenna
Reviews.Author: Frilly Knickers
Reviews.Content: Summary: overall a great machine that's killed by a horrible WiFi antenna. ChromeOS is designed for an "always connected" world, and a poor, flaky WiFi connection makes for a very disappointing experience.Pros:  - really quick boot up time of 7s  - great battery life  - ChromeOS has improved greatly in the past few years  - Haswell CPU is quick + battery life of ~8h!Cons:  - 720p resolution is not quite enough for a 11.6" monitor (but I have great eyesight so I'm pretty picky). 1080p would have done the trick.  - Horrible WiFi antenna. I have to be within 10' of my WiFi router to reliably connect, while I've never had any problems anywhere in my house with any of the plethora of other devices I own(ed). As mentioned above, this is an absolutely horrible thing to do to a device designed to be "always connected."

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to love this

For the price I thought this was great and I loved the concept. It was small and fast and perfect for those times when I just wanted to watch a movie or do a little shopping. However 6 months after purchasing the unit, the cord went bad. I had to go round and round with Acer to send me a replacement cord. I even had to buy an off brand replacement until I could get them to ship one out. Then I started having issues with the unit heating up too much and shutting down on me even when I was not running any apps. The last straw was when, less than a week after the year long warranty  ran out, the jack for the power cord started malfunctioning. I could only get it to charge in a few positions. I looked into getting it fixed and it will cost more to have it fixed than what it cost me to purchase the Item, a total loss.I now write this review from the MacBook Pro that I finally just bit the bullet and bought. I'm going to upgrade my SEVEN year old Mackbook to use in conjunction with the Pro.I was not expecting the Chromebook to last as long as my Mac, but seriously, a year? Shame on you Acer. Just bite the bullet and buy the PC or Mac you really want.Edit:I have the previous version of this but my brothers (which is pretty much identical except for the caseand battery life) is having the same issues as well. At least his is still under warranty. Still will not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Not too bad
Reviews.Author: Sonja
Reviews.Content: They do lag a bit..Was very disappointed that my kids couldn't play minecraft on it especially after I spent 30 bucks on a minecraft computer game..Kids think it's ok..Does have some good features to it..Wouldn't ever purchase another one..I think it would be good for those who aren't really into much but social media or surfing the internet..

Reviews.Title: Skype is not supported
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Donaghy
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a good light-weight device to use when traveling to Europe.  Now I find out it doesn't support Skype and there is no work-around to use in Europe.  I would not have bought it if I was aware of this limitation.  My fault for not doing more extensive research and Google's fault for not supporting a rival company's application

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy If You Live Outside USA
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Colbath
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement computer for my wife, because most of what she does is online and she would not have to worry about backing up or moving files, as they are kept on Google Drive.This appealed to her, but the problem is that none of the apps from Google Play can be installed. We live out of country and any time she tries to install an app it says "This app is not available in your country." I'm having a hard time understanding why something that is installed via Internet, which we have, should be unavailable outside the USA.Given the limitation, the term "Chromebook" should be named "Chrome Browser". Browsing is the only thing you can do if you live abroad.

Reviews.Title: Broke two months after purchase
Reviews.Author: xazp "kai_97"
Reviews.Content: Two months after we bought the Chromebook, the battery stopped charging, rendering it pretty much useless.  Having owned many laptops in the past, this has broken the fastest (and probably received the least amount of use).  Acer is honoring their warranty and will probably fix it.I think it is an OK laptop, the chief attraction is the price.

Reviews.Title: possibly a defective one
Reviews.Author: elizabeth m gola
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this chromebook has been shutting off repeatedly and i have to find out how i can exchange it.I purchased it for my daughter for christmas for her schoolwork.

Reviews.Title: This is a "don't buy"
Reviews.Author: fred olsen
Reviews.Content: This item was ordered and rec'd on December 24, 2013, a gift for my granddaughter. It worked just slightly over 30 days and can't be returned.  Don't know if Acer has a guarantee/warranty but Amazon won't take it back so we're stuck trying to fix it or trash it.

Reviews.Title: Should've researched it better
Reviews.Author: Emily Stevens
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize that there was no way to download Microsoft Office or print off anything other than from the beta cloud on the print settings in the Chrome browser.  Also, some software downloaded wasn't able to be used because it could only be used for Mac or Windows. So, I still need my older, crappier laptop for these things. Sad.

Reviews.Title: Chrome Book is Geat little computer
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: Just arrived will get back to you and let you know about how it works. Just put in wifi codes and charging.So far so good. This little Chromebook is fast.  Just need to get to the keys and program.

Reviews.Title: still figuring
Reviews.Author: gerald skislak "Tell us about yourself!63,act...
Reviews.Content: The one complaint I have is that I understood that Microsoft eight came with this devise. It is a system I'm fully confident on and would prefer it. We will see how everything goes but I haven't had much luck with different systems. I have never really gone from novice to any other level. At 60 I'm not to interested in broadening my horizons./g

Reviews.Title: I shouldn't have bought it.
Reviews.Author: lixu
Reviews.Content: If you just go online, it's ok. I won't tell you sometimes  google chrome just stops working for no reason.The reason I bought it is because my Toshiba laptop is running very slow now and I don't like typing on my tablet, so I tried to find some " simple laptop"  , which is with a keyboard and works fast.  I won''t play any game and run any sophisticated program such as photoshop on it.  That's all.Is it too much??!!!I tried to use the quick office once, guess what?  I lost all the documents finally...I'm very disappointed with it.Anyone who needs a "real laptop" shouldn't buy it at all. I feel so regret now.

Reviews.Title: No tablet support
Reviews.Author: Lucie Lillistine
Reviews.Content: It works great for what it is I guess. But I purchased this with the intention of using it for graphic art and it has absolutely no tablet support. So beware before you purchase if you're looking for a laptop to use with a pen tablet, this isn't it. I now own a 170$ web browser basically.

Reviews.Title: Good starter laptop
Reviews.Author: Idalis Blackwell
Reviews.Content: A lot of software is not compatible with this computer. It's a hassle, you well need a real laptop to go with it if you do more than web and chrome.

Reviews.Title: a bit buggy
Reviews.Author: willia
Reviews.Content: perhaps more chrome than chromebook... but kind of buggy... frequently freezes-up... It's not my connection, have several (windows) laptops with no issues, but more of an explorer user on those.3/9/14... Update.... kinda of in POS territory after a couple months. Real slow resolving url / web surfing. Down to 1 star. If I had to do it over again... would spend another hundred... and get a "real" laptop.

Reviews.Title: Constantly getting Error code: ERR_NAME_RESOLUTION_FAILED
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I've had the Acer c720 for about 12 days now and I'm constantly getting "Error code: ERR_NAME_RESOLUTION_FAILED" along with the message "Webpage not available". The machine will work fine for a while and then start displaying this error and no website will load. It does it several times a day and is very annoying. I play around with it, (clearing the browsing history or disabling and enabling wifi) to see it that fixes it. Sometimes that works but not always. At first i thought it was my internet, but whenever this happens, i check my other wireless devices and they are working fine. If anybody has a solution for this, please let me know. When the Acer does work, it works beautifully. I would love to give it more stars but the fact that it keeps dropping the internet connection is really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Still unable to turn it on (use it)after receiving it ONE month ago
Reviews.Author: garrison w waters
Reviews.Content: I gave you guys a couple of hundred bucks. A couple of days later I received my chromebook. Chromebooks are promoted as easypeasy, right? You turn them on and there you go!~ Did you know at least SOME chromebooks, say, this one, come with ZERO instructions? First you charge them, open the screen, choose your wireless server and instantly see, in red letters, "BAD PASSPHRASE". WHAT?!?! Slow forward a month- NO one in the US or Bangladesh can or will tell you what bad passphrase is or has a good passphrase they will share with you, the customer. Though, of course, I will rate the wear and tear on the item as at least a 5+!  L  OL  L  OL!

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Maria L.Morrison
Reviews.Content: Tiny! My larger one was old and falling apart so I had my son-in-law find me a new one. I am going to get my old one repaired and give this little piece of s*** to my 9 year old granddaughter.

Reviews.Title: birthday day gift
Reviews.Author: Habte
Reviews.Content: I gave  it to one of my friends for his birthday. But he didn't tell me yet how he like it.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Gary LeDonne
Reviews.Content: Google Chrome is a big change from Windows. The change requires a significant time commitment to learn and adapt to a totaling different way of working with data. The old axiom of you get what you pay for applies. The computer is inexpensive but depending how you value your time you will pay in a different way.

Reviews.Title: computer not  useable for school work
Reviews.Author: Luis r. Garcia
Reviews.Content: was not suitable for my on line school work. have to use someone else computer for my school work,no returnable.

Reviews.Title: I bought it for my wife and we ended up giving it to our 14 year old
Reviews.Author: kristy Sinsara
Reviews.Content: It's great to surf the net and NOTHING else.  Small screen.  Apparently I need glasses ; ) LOL  Good buy for a first computer for a teen.  There are ABSOLUTELY NO writing programs on here.  It's seriously just like a bigger version of your iPhone.

Reviews.Title: After having worked beautifully for a year or two, now Shockwave Plugin crashes contstantly
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer a year or two ago. No issues! Get's better with every realease. NOW shockwave player keeps crashing. Can't watch my favorite comedy shows online that use flash. Very frustrated.The technical difficulty, is that there is no way to fix the player in the system, because it's built in. You CAN"T update it from the shockwave website! Who knows what the real issue is. I don't know whether to blame Shockwave or Acer, but this is a very bad problem. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: Grandson unhappy with the size
Reviews.Author: Barbara G. Lewis
Reviews.Content: The screen is much smaller than I realized and it was  a present for my grandson and he does not like the small screen and will probably return . He wanted to watch movies from the screen and it seems to be difficult for him to  see.

Reviews.Title: not  exactly what I expected
Reviews.Author: Dennis McClure
Reviews.Content: I realized that chromebooks were less capable than most laptops, the trade-off being cheaper, lighter, and longer battery life. I do like the long battery life and increased portabilty. I also like not having to worry about viruses and deal with an anti-virus program.What I don't like is the wi-fi interface. I have a netgear N150 router and it loses the signal way too often. I am also unable to log into the router to check and tweak the router settings. I also don't like not being able to print directly to my Brother HL2170 wireless printer. My 1 year old $70 android tablet can print to it using Printbot app but you're out of luck with the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Much Slower than the 4GB Version
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I wish Acer had put both versions in the market instead of the low-cost and less capable one. The 4GB version is much, much faster than the 2GB one but most folks don't know the difference. Really NOT cool to put both models in the same review on Amazon's part.

Reviews.Title: chromebook
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S.
Reviews.Content: Got this for my son-in-law.  I don't know much about what this was, but he is into electronics & I knew her didn't have one.  To me the only bad part is it doesn't run Windows.  That is my fault for not doing more checking.  I did give him a choice of exchanging it for a regular laptop or keeping this & he chose to keep this, so at least he was satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: This is great but...
Reviews.Author: Doc Win
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great... but you have to search for the series which is written in fine print... if you got to Acer's website... this series 2848 is way cheaper than what they are selling it for in here. They make it very generic with C720... but C720 comes in many series. Look it up and do a little research... this series will cost you 199.99 at the Acer's website: [...] but they are selling it here for way over that price. Your thinking your getting a great deal but your not. It's over priced and falsely advertised. I wish I had known sooner as I bought two of these thinking it was a great deal for the buck.

Reviews.Title: This is a Google laptop!
Reviews.Author: ryan crowley
Reviews.Content: Turns out i did not know that because it is a laptop made by Google, i can only download Google apps. In buying this product, you will not have (or be able to download) Internet explorer, Firefox, or any other programs that most people download to their computers! I cant even upload my music from my phone because the laptop will not download GOOGLE music manager because the app was built for windows computers! over all, it is ok.... for basic use! the only thing it is really good for is surfing the web!

Reviews.Title: Can't use Skype
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife so she could do basic browsing and video chat with the kids.  The kids have Kindles which won't work with Gchat/vid/Gplus.  However, the Kindles do work with Skype which is nice because Skype is ubiquitous.My brand new Chromebook, however, doesn't work with Skype.  I have to use the Google platform to chat.  I like the Google platform but it's unreasonable to try to force everyone else to use it.So now I have two devices that can't talk to each other as if the technology just isn't capable.  The reality is that these companies are being petty and making their customers suffer.On side-note, the Chrome web store is different than Google Play.  So don't expect that apps from your Android will work on your Chromebook.  They likely won't.My advice is to skip the Chromebook and wait for Google to catch up to user needs.  There are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy a laptop with Chrome OS
Reviews.Author: Jorge E. Heguilor
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's the ONLY computer EVER that cannot connect with a cable to a printer and print.  If your printer is not "Cloud-ready" and you don't have an extra Windows based laptop available, NO PRINT FOR YOU.And 4 days ago Google decided to update the software and now all external monitors have stopped working.  Windows may have been bad, but neved did anything as stupid as this.  Three years from now, when Google has ironed all the bugs, buy one, but paying less for less is not a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Thomas Molodetz
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the glowing reviews this notebook is getting. Maybe if all you use your machine for is checking your e-mail and the weather you'll be happy, but for anything slightly beyond Internet 101, you're going to be frustrated.The problem? The damn Operating System...Google Chrome! What's wrong with Google Chrome? It's so bare-boned, so restrictive it what it allows you to do, I might ask "What's right with it?". Try playing a game on it that requires Java.....ain't gonna happen', Cap'n, because Google Chrome doesn't work with Java! Try installing your favorite browser, say, Mozilla Firefox and watch absolutely nothing happen.because you're locked into using the prepackaged browser Google Chrome.I grabbed this notebook off the shelf of a local Walmart because we've had so much good luck with Acers in the past, it was small enough for travel, and it was cheap. An hour later I was taking it back and exchanging it for an Acer with a real Operating System, not this silly thing called Google Chrome. What exactly is the point of it?

Reviews.Title: very poor suport
Reviews.Author: Edward Qualls "eddie q"
Reviews.Content: not compatible with cloud based printertryed four times to connect to wireless net workno place to install printer cd

Reviews.Title: It was a gift and he didn't like it
Reviews.Author: Susan Dorsen
Reviews.Content: I guess I wasn't aware of exactly what I was purchasing.  I bought it for my husband and he really doesn't like it.  I'm going to send it back and buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Not compatible with anything of Microsoft
Reviews.Author: Susan C. Mason
Reviews.Content: We sent the Chromebook back as we couldn't use a flashdrive with it or print from it.  Very disappointed that it wouldn't work with anything of Microsoft.  Had we known that before hand, we wouldn't have purchased it.  Guess next time we'll do more research before making purchase.

Reviews.Title: Returned it
Reviews.Author: Nick Harris "Carol Harris"
Reviews.Content: This is a computer with an incredible low price but limited capabilities. I returned it to get one that was more versatile.

Reviews.Title: Should've researched more about this comp.
Reviews.Author: mark stafford
Reviews.Content: If you want a all google laptop this is for you otherwise keep looking. Do some research before buying this....

Reviews.Title: Come on Google, you can do a lot better
Reviews.Author: Ralph Laurie
Reviews.Content: There are several things that I don't like about the Chromebook.  First, I can't work offline which is a big deal for me. Second, there is no "DELETE" key which makes editing a real issue. I do like using the google apps but the google programs are at best lousy. It's like Google just through together programs just for the sake of competing. Well they've got a lot of work to do.  I've used Google Docs and it just doesn't have the capabilities of "Word" or "Open Office". I know it's supposed to be a benefit not to have to "SAVE" a document, but sometimes I go into a program and back out but it stays on my list as a "untitled doc or presentation". The Google app that replaces SKYPE is functionally flawed.  It would take several pages of notes to enumerate all the bugs in "DOCS", "Presenter", and "Spreadsheet" programs. The overall functionality of the ACER is great, with the exception of the lack of a "DELETE" Key.  I love the solid state drive which makes computing quick and easy.  The Chromebook was a waste of my hard-earned money.  Unless you just want to live, eat, and breath Google, I don't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Reviews are for different product!!!
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: I'm looking at the Acer C720 with 2g memory.Seems like all the reviews supposedly for said 2g product are actually for the same Chromebook but with 4g memory which costs $150 more. That's bogus Amazon!!!!!Haven't received it yet. Just giving everyone a. "Heads up"

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY
Reviews.Author: Tucker Stump
Reviews.Content: I hate this I wouldnt even call it a laptop it cant do anything without wifi it can only get stuff from the chrome store you cant download anything besides pictures its a waste of $250Pros: its lightCons: everything other than lightness

Reviews.Title: UBER SCREEN DAMAGE. Bad quality
Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: When I first got this computer I loved it, but after a few months I really started regretting my decision. This is strictly Chrome, which means that you cannot use any type of microsoft or skype programming. You cannot play any PC games either, because this is technically not a PC, and does not support games. (Not that that was my main concern, just throwing it in there!) I have never dropped my computer or mishandled it in any way. Im very gentle and take good care of all my electronics, so needless to say when my screen started messing up out of no where, I was not happy. One day when I turned my computer on the screen had lines going all through it, and now its only gotten worse. Along the edges there is big black blobs where its just missing, and it is also "staticy" in places. It does have a year long warranty on it, but when I called I could not get a hold of any one that could speak proper English, and I was too frustrated to care any more. I decided to give it to my little brother who would only use it for YouTube, and I am buying myself a Surface Tablet. It does its job for which its made for, but there is not a lot of great qualities about it. If you want a good quality computer, spend a little more and get one! Just because this is a "steal" at 250, does not mean you should jump on it. You get what you pay for, and I recommend getting something a little more expensive knowing that It will last a LOT longer than the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Sent it back as soon as I used it.
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: It may be a Chromebook thing but I didn't like the operating system, it's not compatible with any Windows programs and it isn't even usuable without the internet.

Reviews.Title: Do your research -- this is a very limited product
Reviews.Author: Angus
Reviews.Content: While the Chromebook is quick, light, portable, and very inexpensive, ultimately one needs to be aware that what one can actually do with the Chromebook (without purchasing a variety of apps) is extremely limited. As the product description indicates, it is made to use only google programs. What this means is that you will not be able to use Word or any Office program and in addition you will be limited in terms of the types of files you can open on the computer. It would seem that Google makes its money through this product by forcing you to purchase apps to make the machine functional. At the end of the day, you may not be saving any money and you may be purchasing a big hastle.

Reviews.Title: Chrome book
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 11 year old grandson for Christmas.  He really was very excited recieving this and was told it "does a lot"there is a game he only likes to play and it is called...... Minecraft.  Unfortunately he can not get it on the chrome book.  Even though I did ask dealers regarding that paticular gameThe thought of returning it crossed my mind however I do not have the receipt.....and or shiping label.  I thought I gave that all to my grandson however he does not have it.I really am very disappointment as I heard how wonderful this item is.  In my grandsons eyes, it is not.  I am disappointed as this grandson is a very "quite"  and he was just so excited about the chrome book and within an hour of recieving it discovered it did not meet his expectations.  Another aggrivating issue is I asked around and called stores that usually carry the chrome book and they just went on and on.  I specifically asked about games and was told "no problem, plays them all"  Well it doesn't.  Not quite sure what I need to do next, all I know is I have a very disappointment boy in my family.Thanks You for listening

Reviews.Title: does not work for what i need

Reviews.Content: i did not realize the operating system would not work for the service provider i wanted to use it with.i do not like the fact that it's made to use with google cloud, and that service is free for only 2 years, then you have to pay.i did not realize the operating system was something i was totally unfamiliar with and did not have the programs and features i was used to using.overall it just did not fit my intended purposes and i chose to return it, and got acer with windows instead, which i am perfectly happy with.

Reviews.Content: It does not do everything I need it to.  I will be returning it so if you could please send me a return label I would apprecaite it.

Reviews.Content: Needed something capable of handling Microsoft Word. I have a child soon to be in college and I need a system capable of doing research papers.

Reviews.Title: Do. Not. Buy!
Reviews.Author: Clutch
Reviews.Content: P.O.S., honestly. It's not as great as advertised; thought I could buy a simple laptop for my father but it's just too AHHHH! Don't get it, just teach someone older to use a regular laptop. Merry freakin' Christmas!Edit 2/13/14: After reading all the comments on my review, which I wasn't notified for, I decided to update my review.-This laptop from the start asks you to create a user identification for Google.-The screen is small compared to the laptop my father already uses.-The complexity to this device is within its simplicity.-The boot-up time is not as quick as it states.-If trying to have something simple an older person can use (parent, grandparent), this is not the item for them as it is still just as confusing as a regular laptop [which, by the way, is a laptop that has Internet, browsers, desktop icons, viruses, downloadable content, etc].-Stick with a Nexus, or some kind of tablet that auto updates everything. Download their favorite applications for the user of this tablet then let them be happy with it.If my updated review still leaves any of you that commented, or any future buyers, in confusion then I don't know what to tell you.

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: People haven't you seen the commercials, chrome books aren't laptops. There like Pinocchio, but instead they say " when I grow up I wanna be a real laptop!"

Reviews.Content: this fragile laptop lasted only a day with me before screen cracked from a 3 ft drop from table to floor :(

Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: The laptop was not as i expected , its horrible. i would not recomend  this item to anyoneNot A Happy Customer

Reviews.Title: just another terrible google product
Reviews.Author: mathew lothian
Reviews.Content: just another terrible Google productfragmented Android system built upon stolen IP.all of these products do what Google accused Microsoft of for years forcing individuals to sign up for and use more google services while making it impossible or very difficult for you to use anything developed by a competitor.
